In addition to the rise in mortgage limits in Orleans Parish, other Louisiana parishes saw increases, including Jefferson Parish ($ 585,000 to $ 678,000), St. Bernard Parish ($ 585,000 to $ 678,000), and East Baton Rouge Parish ($ 585,000 to $ 678,000).

A majority of the parishes have seen increases, but some have seen decreases in their limit. Tangipahoa Parish saw the largest decrease, from $ 585,000 in 2022 to $ 487,500 in 2023.

Statewide, the median home prices rose by 8.5 percent from 2022 to 2023, according to the National Association of Realtors (NAR). This rise in home prices is in line with the nationwide trend of a 6.7 percent increase in the median price of homes.

The mortgage limits for Louisiana for the year 2023 were released on December 31st, 2020. The limits are established each year by the FHFA, and are based on the median home price in each parish. The limits are calculated each year based on the changes in median home prices in each parish.

Louisiana’s mortgage limits are higher than the national average and more in line with the mortgage limits seen in other high-cost areas of the country. For example, the mortgage limit for Orleans Parish is higher than the limit for Los Angeles County, California, where the limit is $ 730,000.

The FHFA also sets annual mortgage limits for the Home Affordable Refinance Program (HARP). The mortgage limits for Louisiana for 2023 under HARP are $ 603,000.

The new mortgage limits will give homeowners in Louisiana more options to purchase a home or refinance an existing mortgage. The higher limits may also encourage more people to become homeowners in the state, providing a boost to the housing market in Louisiana.

Louisiana is already seeing a positive trend in the housing market, with sales up 4.4 percent from the previous year. The housing market in the state is expected to continue to improve throughout 2023.

The FHFA sets the mortgage limits annually and publishes the information on its website. Homeowners can also check with their mortgage lender to find out the limits for their particular county or parish.

Louisiana’s mortgage limits for 2023 are the highest they’ve been in recent years and should provide potential home buyers with more options when it comes to finding a home. The stock market had a roller coaster year in 2020, but 2021 has been a year of consolidation and investors have been trying to make sense of the market amid a looming recession.

It’s been a volatile year in the markets, with a lot of changes in the way investors think about stocks. There’s been a lot of uncertainty about where the markets are headed, but one thing is certain: investors have been closely watching the valuations of stocks.

One way to understand a stock’s value is through multiples. Multiples, or price-to-earnings ratios, are a way to compare one stock to another and measure how a stock is doing in relation to its peers. The lower the multiple, the better the stock is performing relative to its peers.

But multiples can be tricky. A stock’s multiple can go up and down, depending on a variety of factors, including the sector it’s in, the size of the company, and the overall state of the markets. That means that the same stock can have two different multiples at different points in time.

And as we enter a period of heightened recession risks, multiples become even more important to watch. When the economy is slowing, stock prices may drop, which means that investors need to look closely at the valuations of companies to make sure they’re not overpaying for stocks.

The good news is that many stocks are still trading at relatively low multiples, even after the strong rally in the markets this year. That means that investors can still get good value out of buying stocks at these levels.

However, investors should also pay attention to the stocks that have high multiples and may be overvalued. These stocks may be more vulnerable to downside risks in a recession and investors should proceed with caution.

At the same time, investors should also watch out for stocks with low multiples. While a low multiple can be attractive, it can also be a sign that the stock is undervalued, which could be a sign of a fundamental problem with the company.

Overall, investors should be careful when using multiples to evaluate stocks and should take into account other factors like earnings growth and the overall health of the economy.

It’s been an interesting year for the markets and investors have had to navigate some tricky waters. As we head into 2021, investors should keep a close eye on multiples and be aware of how they can affect stock valuations.

It really made me grow up and I learned a lot about discretion and friendship . A girl on my lacrosse team always bashes sororities , but she 's closest with all the girls in Greek life on our team . It 's amazing if you find the right house with the right girls . Every house at every campus during different generations are COMPLETELY DIFFERENT . Google Maps recently rolled out a massive update that significantly enhances its navigation capabilities for electric vehicle (EV) drivers. The new updates, available on both iOS and Android devices, give users access to a variety of new tools that let them locate charging stations and check pricing information.

The recent updates come at a time when the need for EV charging infrastructure is growing rapidly in the United States. The popularity of electric vehicles has increased in recent years, with more than two million electric cars in use in the United States alone. 

To accommodate this growth in EV usage, Google Maps has added new features that allow users to quickly and easily find available charging stations. When a user searches for a charging station, they will now be able to see a “charging station layer” that highlights various levels of charging stations. They will also be able to view real-time updates of the station's availability and price information.

Furthermore, Google Maps now supports both AC and DC fast-charging systems. This allows users to easily identify the fastest charging speed their EV can handle, as well as find stations that offer the fastest charging speeds. Additionally, the new Google Maps update also gives users the ability to compare charging stations based on price, features, and availability. 

Along with the charging station updates, Google Maps has added a new “EV Journey Planner” feature. This feature provides users with a recommended route that takes into account their EV's battery range, as well as the location and availability of charging stations. Users can also input a specific time frame for their journey and the route will automatically adjust to ensure that their EV has enough power to get them to their destination.

Google Maps has also improved its EV charging station search features. Users now have access to detailed information about each station, such as the type of charging technology available, the number of outlets, and estimated charging times. This helps users make informed decisions on which charging station to use.

The updates to Google Maps are a welcomed addition for electric vehicle drivers. By providing access to detailed information and tools, Google Maps is helping to make EV ownership easier and more convenient. This is particularly important as more people turn to electric vehicles as their primary mode of transportation. The new features will enable EV drivers to confidently find the best charging station and make the most of their EV journeys.

In 1994, Pointer reunited with her sisters and the trio released their reunion album, “The Best of the Pointer Sisters.” Over the next two decades, they continued to tour and released the albums “Only Sisters Can Do That” (2003) and “Go Little Sister” (2009).

Anita Pointer will be remembered for her vocal range, stylishness and her contribution to music. Frances Haugen, the whistleblower who exposed Facebook’s algorithms, says Elon Musk should follow her example if he wants Twitter to be a public square.

The news comes as the Tesla CEO and multi-billionaire is attempting to persuade Congress to grant him the right to own a public Twitter account with full access to its algorithms.

Haugen, who worked at Facebook for more than three years as a data analyst, first brought the company's algorithms to light when she testified before the House Committee on Oversight and Reform in 2018.

“If Elon Musk wants to make Twitter into a public square, then he should make the algorithms that govern its content open source, just like I did with Facebook,” Haugen told Business Insider.

Elon Musk has been a vocal advocate of transparency on social media, advocating for the use of open source software and encouraging users to check the code of their platforms.

But the tech giant has yet to make any formal pledge to make its algorithms open source.

“Open source algorithms have been a growing trend in the tech world for some time, but for the most part, social media companies have resisted,” Haugen said. “The algorithms that drive the decisions these platforms make are kept private, which keeps users in the dark about how their data is being used.”

Haugen believes that open source algorithms would make it easier for users to understand how social media platforms operate and ensure that the companies are accountable for their actions.

“Opening up the algorithms would provide an unprecedented level of transparency for users,” she said. “We’d be able to see exactly how companies are making decisions about our data and our content.”

Haugen’s recommendation follows a decision last year by the federal government to make open source its own software.

The move was praised by open source advocates as a step forward in promoting transparency and accountability in the tech world.

Haugen hopes that Elon Musk will take the same step with Twitter and make its algorithms open source.

“Twitter is an incredibly powerful platform, and it has immense influence on the public discourse,” she said. “It’s important that we understand how it works and that its algorithms are open and transparent.”

Despite the potential benefits, open source algorithms can also have their own drawbacks.

If the code is made public, it can be more easily exploited by malicious actors.

“Open source algorithms can be more vulnerable to manipulation,” Haugen cautioned. “They can be used to game the system and game user behavior, which can have far-reaching and sometimes unintended consequences.”

Still, Haugen believes that the potential benefits of open source algorithms far outweigh the risks.

“Ultimately, I think it’s worth the risk,” she said. “It’s worth giving users the chance to see how these platforms are making decisions, and to make sure these companies are held accountable for their actions.”

Yesterday, the Supreme Court of the United States heard oral arguments in a case that could determine the fate of the SAFE-T Act, a federal provision which seeks to end cash bail across the United States. The provision, which was passed in 2019, was challenged in 2020 by a group of sheriffs and court clerks from across the country, who argued that the law was unconstitutional.

The SAFE-T Act was passed as part of the First Step Act, a sweeping criminal justice reform law that sought to address the disparities between low-level, nonviolent offenders and those convicted of more serious crimes. Among the changes it made was the elimination of the federal cash bail system, which had allowed those accused of lower-level crimes to remain in jail until they could afford to pay their way out.

The challengers argued that the federal government had overstepped its bounds by passing a law that superseded the authority of state governments to set bail policies. They further argued that the law was overly burdensome and costly and did not allow for enough flexibility in terms of when and how bail could be granted.

Justice Stephen Breyer acknowledged the challenges that cash bail posed to the justice system, stating that “There's a tremendous amount of evidence that even for the same offenses, African-American defendants are subjected to a different treatment in the criminal justice system than other people...I'm sympathetic to the idea that something needs to change here.”

However, he also expressed skepticism about the federal government’s authority to enact the change that the SAFE-T Act sought to make. He noted that bail reform is traditionally within the purview of state legislatures and that the courts should be “very cautious” when it comes to stepping in and overriding their decisions.

Ultimately, it is likely that the fate of the SAFE-T Act provision will remain in limbo for the foreseeable future. With both the majority of the court and the two appointees from President Joe Biden voicing concerns about its constitutionality, the Supreme Court appears unlikely to rule in favor of the provision. If that’s the case, then it would be up to Congress to pass a new law that could supersede the state laws and pave the way for a new bail reform system.

For those who are eager to see the end of cash bail, there is still hope that some type of reform could eventually be put into place. But it’s also important to keep in mind that this is a complex issue, and it could take time before any major changes are put into effect. Boeing's last 747 Jumbo Jet has rolled out of the factory, ending more than five decades of production for the iconic plane that revolutionized air travel.

The last 747, an LN-25 registered freighter, was delivered from the Boeing plant in Everett, Wash., to an aircraft leasing and trading company based in Singapore. Its final journey marks the end of the 747 era, and the iconic plane will now be consigned to the annals of aviation history.

The original "Queen of the Skies," as the 747 was fondly referred to, made its debut flight in 1969. Since then, it has transported millions of passengers around the world, revolutionizing air travel in the process. The plane's large size allowed for the introduction of the first-ever wide-body cabins, allowing passengers to spread out and enjoy more legroom than ever before. The double-decker plane also ushered in the era of affordable long-haul flights, allowing travelers to fly farther than ever before at a fraction of the cost.

The 747 was so popular that at its peak, Boeing produced over 1,500 of them. The aircraft was a symbol of wealth and luxury, and was famously used by celebrities and world leaders, including US presidents.

But as the years went by, the 747 began to face increasing competition from newer, more efficient aircraft. As airlines began to focus on shorter, point-to-point flights, the 747's place in the market diminished. In 2016, Boeing announced it was officially ending the 747's production run after nearly 50 years in service.

The last "Queen of the Skies" will now be assigned to less glamorous duties, with the new owner planning to use the 747 for cargo and freight transport. But its legacy will live on for years to come, thanks to its many contributions to the aviation industry.

The delivery of the last 747 is both a sad and joyous occasion. While it marks the end of an era, it is also a celebration of what the aircraft has achieved in its more than 50-year production run.

"The 747 brought people together and changed the way people travel," said Marc Allen, president of Boeing Commercial Airplanes. "It's the most recognizable airplane ever built and still holds a special place in the hearts of aviation enthusiasts around the world."

For all of its detractors, the 747 leaves behind an impressive legacy, one that won't be forgotten anytime soon. So, while it may be the end of the line for the 747, its iconic status as the "Queen of the Skies" will remain for years to come.

California is looking at one of the highest snowpacks in the last 40 years after snowstorms swept across the state and the Sierra Nevada mountain range. The snow accumulation is expected to bring much-needed relief to areas that have been devastated by drought over the past decade, while posing potential hazards for those living in mountain communities.

The National Weather Service (NWS) reported that a powerful storm that came through the state last week had contributed to an increase in snowpack levels, particularly in the northern half of the state, including in the Sierra Nevada mountains.

According to the NWS, recent snowpack surveys have indicated that the snowpack across most of the Sierra Nevada range was at 134 percent of average. This is higher than the peak of 129 percent that was measured in December 2019, and the highest snowpack in 40 years.

The snowpack has been gradually increasing in recent weeks as a number of powerful storms have swept through the state, with some areas receiving up to 10 feet of snow in just a few days. The amount of precipitation and snowfall in the Sierra Nevada range has been increasing since October 2020, with the most significant amounts occurring since the start of 2021.

State officials have said that the high levels of snow are a positive sign for California's overall water supply, as they expect it to lead to higher levels of groundwater, as well as higher amounts of water entering the state's reservoirs. The Department of Water Resources said that it expects the snowpack to "provide plenty of beneficial runoff for the state's watersheds and reservoirs, bolstering water supplies that have been stretched thin during the past decade of drought."

The snowpack is also good news for farmers and ranchers in California, who rely on the seasonal runoff to fill reservoirs and irrigate their crops. State officials have said that the snowpack should help to ease the strain on agricultural producers who have been struggling to meet their water demands in recent years.

However, the high levels of snow also have the potential to create some problems in the state, particularly in mountain communities, where avalanches and mudslides can be a danger. The California Department of Forestry and Fire Protection said that it is closely monitoring the snowpack levels and has warned residents in the Sierra Nevada to take caution when engaging in outdoor activities in areas that are subject to avalanche danger.

The snowpack is likely to continue to increase over the coming weeks, as more storms are expected to move through the state. State officials have said that they will continue to monitor the situation closely and will take the necessary precautions to protect the safety of those living in the Sierra Nevada.

text: It is possible for a child to have symptoms of herpes or strep throat at any age, including at 8 months old. However, it is important to note that herpes and strep throat are two different infections caused by different viruses or bacteria.  Herpes is caused by the herpes simplex virus (HSV) and can cause cold sores or genital sores. It is possible for a child to be infected with herpes at birth if the mother has genital herpes, but this is relatively rare. It is more common for children to become infected with herpes through close contact with someone who has an active herpes infection, such as through kissing or sharing utensils or cups.  Strep throat is caused by the bacterium Streptococcus pyogenes and is a common infection that affects the throat and tonsils. It is most common in children between the ages of 5 and 15, but it can occur at any age. Strep throat is typically spread through close contact with an infected person, such as through coughing, sneezing, or sharing utensils or cups.  The symptoms you have described, including red spots on the roof of the mouth and tongue and a creamy white residue, could potentially be caused by either herpes or strep throat. It is important to have your son examined by a healthcare provider to determine the cause of these symptoms and to receive appropriate treatment. The provider may need to perform a physical examination and possibly order some tests, such as a throat culture or a herpes test, to diagnose the cause of your son's symptoms.

Lightyear, the Dutch electric-vehicle (EV) manufacturer, announced their second solar-powered car today. Dubbed the Lightyear One, the vehicle will be offered for a starting price of €35,000 (around $40,000 USD).

The new solar-powered EV is a follow-up to the Lightyear Three, which was the first vehicle from the company and was released in 2019. Lightyear One follows a similar design language as the Lightyear Three and features a number of improvements. The vehicle's battery pack has been improved, with a total capacity of 60 kWh and a range of 560 km (347 miles) on a full charge. Additionally, the vehicle has been fitted with a new solar roof which can generate up to 10 kWh of energy per day, effectively allowing the vehicle to drive "infinitely" on solar power.

In addition to the new solar roof, the Lightyear One also features an improved aerodynamic design and a drag coefficient of 0.18 – making it one of the most aerodynamic cars on the market. Other features include an adjustable suspension system and an improved range of driver-assist technologies.

The car has already begun deliveries in the Netherlands, but the company plans to start shipping the cars to other countries over the next few months. Lightyear has also announced that it is working on a subscription-based model which will allow customers to purchase the vehicle on a monthly basis.

In terms of performance, the Lightyear One can accelerate from 0-60 mph in a little over five seconds and has a top speed of 130 mph. While these figures may not be as impressive as some other EVs on the market, the fact that it is solar-powered more than makes up for it.

Lightyear is hoping that the release of the One will help to reduce the carbon footprint of driving, and in the process, help to reduce carbon emissions from the transport sector. With its solar-powered capabilities, the vehicle could potentially be an effective way of reducing one's carbon footprint.

It's not just the vehicle itself that will be helping to reduce emissions either. Lightyear has also announced that they are planning on using 100% sustainable materials in the manufacturing of the vehicle, and they are working on partnerships with companies such as energy providers and recyclers to ensure that the car's entire lifecycle is as carbon-neutral as possible.

The company has also announced that it will be releasing a new version of its app which will allow users to monitor their car's energy consumption and solar generation, enabling them to adjust their charging and usage habits to make sure that they get the most out of their vehicle.

Lightyear One is set to be a great step forward in the world of EVs and solar-powered cars. The vehicle offers impressive specs and features, and at a price point of around $40,000, it is likely to be a popular option for those looking to reduce their emissions without breaking the bank.

The history of space exploration is one marked with tragedy and triumph. On December 26, 2022, the world remembers the three brave cosmonauts who lost their lives in the pursuit of understanding the universe beyond Earth.

On March 5th, 2021, the world was watching as three Russian astronauts, Alexander Yegorov, Vitali Kovalev and Nikolai Khutorsky, attempted to become the first people to travel beyond the confines of Earth's atmosphere. The three astronauts were part of a joint mission between Russia and the United States to explore the outermost reaches of the solar system.

The mission was a success and the three men successfully flew their Soyuz spacecraft more than 350 million kilometers away from Earth. They made several discoveries, including a new planet, a mysterious black hole and evidence of a possible alien civilization.

However, tragedy struck when the spacecraft entered a radiation belt. The powerful radiation from this belt caused critical damage to the spacecraft's systems and communication links to Earth were severed.

The crew were now stranded in the darkness of outer space, with no hope of being rescued. They were running low on oxygen, food and water, and had no contact with mission control on Earth. With no way of knowing whether or not their situation would improve, the brave cosmonauts prepared for the worst.

On March 7th, 2021, the three men tragically perished in space, forever linked by the bond of their shared experience and their heroic quest for knowledge.

The public was devastated by the news of their passing and many tributes were paid to their memory. A memorial service was held in Moscow, where hundreds of people gathered to pay their respects to the three brave cosmonauts.

The entire world mourned the loss of these men, who had risked their lives to expand our knowledge of the cosmos. The families of the three men were given a special honor by the Russian government, which declared a national day of mourning and remembrance.

The tragedy of their loss was a stark reminder of the risks that come with space exploration. While the mission was ultimately a success, it also served as a reminder of the sacrifices made by those brave enough to venture into the unknown.

Although the three cosmonauts are gone, their legacy will live on forever. They are a reminder of humanity's desire to explore the depths of outer space, and to unlock its secrets. In their memory, we honor the courage and tenacity that it takes to explore the great unknown.

text:
GDP stands for Gross Domestic Product. It is a measure of the total amount of goods and services produced in a country in a given year. It is used to understand how well a country's economy is doing.

Think of GDP like a big pie that represents all of the different things that are produced in a country. The bigger the pie, the more things that are being produced and the better the economy is doing. The pie can be divided into smaller pieces to show how much of it is made up of different types of goods and services.

For example, if a country makes a lot of cars, that would be a big part of its GDP pie. If it also makes a lot of clothes and grows a lot of food, those would be smaller pieces of the pie. The total size of all of these pieces added together is the country's GDP.

GDP is important because it helps us understand how much a country is producing and how well its economy is doing. It can also help us compare how well different countries' economies are doing.

text:
Job openings fell in October amid Federal Reserve efforts to cool a record-setting labor market.

The Labor Department said Wednesday that job openings fell by 389,000 in October, a decrease of 2.9 percent from the prior month. The number of job openings in October stood at 12.87 million, down from 13.26 million in September.

The drop in job openings came after the Federal Reserve took a number of steps to cool the hot job market, including introducing a cap on corporate buybacks and suspending stock dividends. The moves were intended to limit the amount of money companies spend on their own stock instead of investing in jobs and wage increases.

At the same time, the labor market is still on a hot streak. Last week, the Labor Department said the economy added 638,000 jobs in October, the highest monthly gain since the recovery began in May. The unemployment rate fell to 6.9 percent, down from 7.9 percent in September.

But the pace of job growth has slowed in recent months, with employment increasing by just 1.8 million in the past three months, down from more than 4 million in the previous three-month period. The pace of hiring is being held back by a variety of factors, including a surge in coronavirus cases, uncertainty about the election and the lack of another round of federal stimulus.

The number of unemployed in October was nearly 11 million, with the unemployment rate for African-Americans at 10.8 percent, for Hispanics at 8.3 percent and for Asian-Americans at 6.7 percent.

The Fed’s efforts to cool the job market appear to be having an effect, with the number of job openings declining in recent months. It remains to be seen whether the Fed’s efforts will be enough to slow hiring in the months ahead or if companies will continue to hire as the economy recovers.

The October job openings report also showed that hiring was down significantly in some sectors of the economy. Construction, transportation and retail were all hit hard, while openings in the government sector rose by 8.8 percent. The manufacturing and healthcare sectors also experienced a small drop in job openings.

The report also showed that job openings in the professional and business services sector were down by 4.1 percent, while openings in education and health services fell by 1.2 percent.

With job openings down, the U.S. economy is entering a period of slower job growth and weaker wage gains. The economy still has a ways to go before returning to pre-pandemic levels of employment, and the Fed’s efforts to cool the job market could further slow the pace of hiring. But the October job openings report provides evidence that the central bank’s efforts could be having an impact.

text: NASA retired the Space Shuttle program in 2011 because it had accomplished its goals and was becoming too expensive to maintain. The Space Shuttle was a reusable spacecraft that was used for many different missions, including transporting astronauts to and from the International Space Station (ISS). It was a very advanced and complex vehicle, but it also had some limitations.  One of the reasons NASA decided to use rockets instead of a new upgraded type of Space Shuttle for the Orion spacecraft is that rockets are generally more powerful and can reach higher altitudes and faster speeds than the Space Shuttle. This is important for deep space missions, such as going to the Moon or Mars, because these destinations are much farther away from Earth than the ISS.  Another reason is that the Space Shuttle required a lot of maintenance and preparation between flights, which made it less flexible and efficient than rockets. Rockets can be launched more quickly and can be used for a wider range of missions.  Finally, NASA is always looking for ways to improve and advance its technology, and developing a new type of Space Shuttle would have been a very expensive and time-consuming project. Instead, NASA chose to focus on developing new rockets and spacecraft that are more suited to deep space exploration.

text: Root canal treatment is a common procedure that is performed to save a tooth that has become infected or damaged. After a root canal procedure, a crown (also called a cap) is often placed on the tooth to protect it and restore it to its normal function. The life expectancy of a root canal treated and crowned tooth can vary, but with proper care and maintenance, it can last for many years.  It is important to maintain good oral hygiene by brushing and flossing regularly and visiting your dentist regularly for check-ups and cleanings. This can help to extend the life of your root canal treated tooth. In some cases, a root canal treated tooth may fail despite good oral hygiene and regular dental care. If this occurs, there are several options that may be considered, including:  Retreatment: In some cases, it may be possible to perform another root canal procedure to try to save the tooth.  Endodontic surgery: If the root canal treatment was not successful or the tooth has become infected again, a surgical procedure called an apicoectomy (also known as root-end resection) may be recommended to remove the infected tissue at the tip of the root and seal the end of the root canal.  Tooth extraction: If the tooth cannot be saved, it may need to be extracted. After the tooth is extracted, your dentist may recommend replacing it with a dental implant, bridge, or partial denture.  It is important to consult with your dentist to determine the best course of action for your specific situation.

text: As you get closer to the center of the Earth, the gravitational pull on you becomes stronger. This is because the mass of the Earth is concentrated more towards the center, so there is more mass pulling you towards it as you get closer.  Imagine you are standing on a scale on the surface of the Earth. The scale measures how much gravity is pulling you down. Now imagine you start digging a tunnel straight down through the Earth. As you get deeper and closer to the center of the Earth, the scale would show that the gravitational pull on you is getting stronger. This is because there is more mass below you, pulling you towards it.  The same is true if you were to go up into space. The further you get from the Earth, the weaker the gravitational pull becomes because there is less mass around you to pull you towards it.

The world number three came through in one hour and 44 minutes, fending off a late surge by the world number 79 after leading 6-4, 4-1.

He has already made it to the quarter-finals of the Australian Open and the semi-finals of the Brisbane International this year.

"It's not an easy draw but I'm really confident that I can make it further," he said.

The former Wimbledon finalist will now have his sights set firmly on a run to the title.

text:
El líder de la mayoría del Partido Republicano en la Cámara de Representantes, el Congresista Kevin McCarthy, llevó su anhelo por llegar a la Casa Blanca al siguiente nivel esta semana, con una entrevista exclusiva con CNN donde habló de sus ambiciones, su decepción y su compromiso de gobernar.

McCarthy, que se ha postulado repetidamente para la presidencia de la Cámara en los últimos años sin éxito, parecía resignado a su destino durante la entrevista. "Simplemente no ha salido como pensé que sería", dijo. "Es una lucha dura y parece que mis esfuerzos no han bastado. La mayoría de los líderes parlamentarios tienen que esperar mucho tiempo para poder llegar a la Casa Blanca, y yo no soy diferente".

En lugar de poner el enfoque en lo que no ha podido hacer, McCarthy parece estar obsesionado con lo que sí puede lograr. Sus objetivos como presidente de la Cámara incluyen aumentar la transparencia en el gobierno, mejorar la economía, modernizar el sistema de impuestos, aumentar la inversión en infraestructura y proteger a los trabajadores estadounidenses.

"La política no es algo que quiero simplemente para mí mismo, sino para los Estados Unidos de América", dijo. "Creo que si podemos lograr estas cosas, podemos mejorar la calidad de vida de la gente de esta nación".

Sin embargo, el líder republicano también se dio cuenta de que aunque su deseo de llegar a la Casa Blanca es grande, hay algunas cosas que no puede controlar. "No hay forma de que pueda predecir el futuro", dijo. "No sé qué nos deparará el mañana, y cualquier cosa puede pasar en cualquier momento. Así que tengo que mantener la fe y seguir adelante".

"Espero que los demócratas se abran a nuestras ideas y reconozcan que no siempre estamos equivocados", dijo. "Espero que encontremos un terreno común para lograr resultados que nos beneficien a ambos".

text:
Demand for rural homes in Britain has dropped in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic, a new report suggests.

The findings, from the Nationwide Building Society, suggest that the demand for rural homes has fallen in all regions of Britain, as prices continue to rise.

The report found that the demand for rural homes had fallen in the nine months to December 2020, compared to the previous year. The West Midlands and Yorkshire were the worst hit regions, with demand dropping by 18 per cent. In contrast, demand in London, the South West and the East of England rose by six and nine per cent respectively.

Nationwide said the drop in demand was likely to be the result of the economic uncertainty caused by the pandemic, and the fact that people were reassessing their spending priorities.

“The COVID-19 pandemic has altered people’s views on where they want to live,” said Nick Durrant, mortgage director at Nationwide. “For some, that means a shift away from rural locations and towards city living.”

He added that people had also become more focused on their finances and what they could afford.

“With mortgage rates at historic lows, people are taking a hard look at their budget to see where they can free up some cash,” said Durrant.

The report also revealed that the average price of a rural home had risen by 8.8 per cent to £268,000 in the nine months to December. In contrast, prices in cities had risen by just 4.1 per cent.

The Nationwide report suggested that the fall in demand had been driven by the huge increase in the number of people working from home due to the pandemic.

“Many people found that they could work just as effectively away from the office,” said Durrant. “This gave them the freedom to relocate to more rural locations.”

The report also pointed to the fact that people have been rethinking their finances in the wake of the pandemic, and were looking for a more affordable location.

“The pandemic has made many people think twice about how they spend their money,” said Durrant. “This has driven some people to look for more affordable homes, and rural properties may be seen as a more cost-effective option than city living.”

However, the report also warned that demand for rural homes is likely to recover over the next year, as the economic impact of the pandemic starts to fade.

“As the economy recovers, people may become more confident in their job security, and we could start to see an increase in demand,” said Durrant.

He added that while demand for rural homes is likely to remain subdued in the short term, it is likely to pick up in the longer term as the effects of the pandemic start to recede.

“As people become more secure in their finances, we could see rural living become increasingly attractive,” said Durrant.

text: I'm a retired stockbroker/Registered Investment Advisor. My initial discussions with prospects never had a fee.  Restricted stock is unsaleable without specific permission from the issuing company, and typically involves time specifc periods when stock can be sold and/or amounts of stock that can be sold. Not for DIY. Financial planners may be able to assist you, if they are conversant in restricted stock, though that's not a common situation for most clients. Any stockbroker at a major firm (Merrill Lynch, UBS, Royal Bank of Canada, Morgan Stanley, JP Morgan, etc.) will be knowledgeable and advise you (w/o charge) how to trade the stock. Always talk to more than one firm, and don't be in a hurry. If you feel comfortable with the discussion, you can pursue a deeper relationship. In my professional experience, clients valued service, accessibility, knowledge. Price was way down on the list; many of my clients were not wealthy people- they just needed help navigating a very confusing (and necessary) part of their lives. Good luck.

text: I am not aware of a version of Interac available in the U.S., but there are alternative ways to receive money: Cheque. The problem with mailed cheques is that they take time to deliver, and time to clear. If you ship your wares before the cheque has cleared and the cheque is bad, you're out the merchandise. COD. How this works is you place a COD charge on your item at the post office in the amount you charge the customer. The post office delivers the package on the other end when the customer pays. The post office pays you at the time you send the package. There is a fee for this, talk to your local post office or visit the Canada Post website. Money order. Have your U.S. customers send an International Money Order, not a Domestic Money Order. Domestic money orders can only be cashed at a U.S. post office. The problem here is again delivery time, and verifying your customer sent an International Money Order. It can be a pain to have to send back a Domestic Money Order to a customer explaining what they have to do to pay you, even more painful if you don't catch the error before shipping your wares. Credit Card. There are a number of companies offering credit card processing that are much cheaper than a bank. PayPal, Square, and Intuit are three such companies offering these services. After I did my investigations I found Square to be the best deal for me. Please do your own research on these companies (and banks!) and find out which one makes the most sense for you. Some transaction companies may forbid the processing of payment for e-cig materials as they my be classed as tobacco.

The case involved a man from Florida who was arrested in September of 2020 on charges related to a burglary. According to the man’s lawyer, the arrest was based on facial recognition technology that incorrectly identified the man as the perpetrator.

The lawyer, Justin Bentley, said that the man was arrested on a warrant that was based on an image of the burglary suspect that was gathered from surveillance video and then analyzed with a facial recognition system. However, according to Bentley, the image of the man’s face was not a perfect match for the suspect’s face, and the arrest was based on a false match.

Bentley said that the man was held in jail for several days before the charges were dropped and that he is now suing the police department for damages.

“This case is a reminder of the dangers of relying on facial recognition technology without proper safeguards,” Bentley said. “We must recognize the potential for mistakes, and put in place measures to ensure that facial recognition technology is used responsibly and with proper checks and balances in place.”

The case has raised new concerns about the accuracy of facial recognition systems, which have been increasingly used by law enforcement to identify suspects. In recent years, facial recognition systems have been heavily criticized for their potential for misidentification and for their potential for bias in determining matches.

Critics of facial recognition technology say that the systems are prone to error, and that there is a lack of oversight of how the systems are used by law enforcement. They also argue that the systems have been used disproportionately against people of color, which can lead to false arrests and unjust incarceration.

In response to the case in Florida, several civil rights organizations have called for greater transparency in how law enforcement agencies use facial recognition systems. The organizations have asked the police department to release information on how the system was used, how it identified the man, and what safeguards were in place to ensure accuracy.

Facial recognition technology is becoming increasingly popular, with many businesses and law enforcement agencies now using it to identify and track individuals. However, critics of the technology argue that more must be done to ensure that it is used responsibly, and that safeguards are in place to protect individuals from wrongful arrests.

“We must ensure that facial recognition technology is used in a manner that is respectful of human rights,” Bentley said. “We must have strict laws and regulations in place to ensure that the technology is not used recklessly or unfairly.”

The shortage has been compounded by poor harvests in both the United States and abroad, as well as a rapid increase in demand from both emerging markets and developed countries.

"The fertilizer crisis has been further exacerbated by the global pandemic, which has caused significant disruption to the shipping and supply chain," Viviani wrote in the note.

He added that SABIC Agri-Nutrients, the world's largest producer of nitrogen-based fertilizer, was uniquely positioned to take advantage of the situation and that its shares would benefit greatly.

The research note also highlighted the fact that the global shortage has seen the price of nitrogen fertilizer increase by more than 20% since the start of the year, while SABIC's shares have risen by 5%.

Viviani said that "Given that this supply-side issue is global in nature, and SABIC is the largest producer of nitrogen-based fertilizer, we expect the company's shares to appreciate by at least 50% this year."

This projection was echoed by other analysts. Credit Suisse analyst William Jackson said that "With the supply side unlikely to change significantly in the near future, we expect SABIC's share price to continue to increase as the world scrambles to increase crop production."

Similarly, Goldman Sachs analyst David Parker noted that the company's large market share, along with its ability to remain agile during volatile market conditions, could see the company's share price increase significantly.

"SABIC is in a great position to benefit from the worldwide fertilizer shortage," Parker wrote in his research note. "Its large share of the market and its ability to rapidly adjust to changing market conditions makes it a great choice for investors looking for exposure to this sector."

The news has also been welcomed by investors, with SABIC's share price rising by 1.7% on the day of the research note's release.

However, the company's gains could be limited by the fact that it is operating in a highly cyclical sector and that fertilizer prices could fall sharply in the near future.

In addition, the company is exposed to political and economic risk in many of the countries it operates in, which could limit its growth potential in the longer term.

Muchos de nosotros nos embriagamos durante las fiestas de fin de año y añoramos el 2 de enero, la fecha para reducir el consumo de alcohol y prepararnos para los buenos propósitos de Año Nuevo. 

Una vez pasadas las celebraciones, la idea de disminuir el consumo de alcohol o incluso eliminarlo por completo puede ser intimidante. Los científicos han desarrollado un programa de cinco claves que podrían ayudarle a tomar el camino correcto.

De acuerdo con The National Institute on Alcohol Abuse and Alcoholism (NIAAA), una bebida estándar equivale a 12 onzas (aproximadamente 355 mililitros) de cerveza, 5 onzas (aproximadamente 148 mililitros) de vino o 1.5 onzas (aproximadamente 44 mililitros) de bebida destilada.

El consumo excesivo de alcohol (más de una bebida estándar para las mujeres y más de dos para los hombres) se ha asociado con problemas de salud, como enfermedades cardíacas, cáncer y cirrosis.

A continuación se incluyen cinco claves para reducir el consumo de alcohol: 

1. Comprométase consigo mismo: El primer paso es reconocer la necesidad de reducir el consumo y comprometerse a hacerlo. Una vez que esté motivado, se necesita una forma de llevar la cuenta, como una app de seguimiento de alcohol o una lista escrita. Esto le ayudará a tomar conciencia de su consumo de alcohol y cumplir con su objetivo de reducción. 

2. Cree un plan: La próxima clave para reducir el consumo de alcohol es crear un plan sólido. Esto incluye escribir una lista de todos los motivos por los que quiere reducir el consumo de alcohol. También puede ayudar a establecer límites y objetivos diarios de consumo de alcohol. 

3. Excluya el alcohol de su entorno: Las tentaciones siempre estarán presentes, así que es importante excluir el alcohol de su entorno. Esto significa evitar los bares, restaurantes, reuniones y cualquier otro lugar en el que se sirva alcohol. Incluso mantener la cantidad de alcohol en su casa al mínimo puede ser una solución. 

4. Reemplace el alcohol con otras cosas: Siempre se ha sabido que reemplazar el alcohol con algo más saludable, como agua, jugos, té o café, puede ayudar a disminuir el consumo de alcohol. Estos refrescos también tienen la ventaja de ser más baratos y contener menos calorías que las bebidas alcohólicas. 

5. Búsqueda de apoyo: La última clave para reducir el consumo de alcohol es buscar apoyo. Un grupo de apoyo o un terapeuta pueden ser excelentes recursos para ayudarle a controlar su consumo. Además, los amigos y la familia que comprenden sus metas pueden ser una gran ayuda cuando intenta mantenerse alejado del alcohol. 

Es importante señalar que reducir el consumo de alcohol no siempre es fácil y puede llevar su tiempo. Si no está seguro de qué camino tomar, consulte con un profesional médico o un terapeuta para recibir ayuda.

La ciencia ha demostrado que reducir el consumo de alcohol ayuda a prevenir los problemas de salud relacionados con el alcohol y mejorar la calidad de vida de

Defibrillators are medical devices that are used to shock the heart back into a normal rhythm. They are often used in cases of cardiac arrest, which is when the heart suddenly stops beating.

When a person's heart stops beating, they may not be able to get enough oxygen to their brain and other organs. This can be very dangerous and can even be deadly. Defibrillators are used to try to restart the heart by sending an electric shock through the chest and into the heart.

Defibrillators work by using two pads that are placed on the person's chest. These pads are connected to the defibrillator, which sends an electric shock through the pads and into the person's heart. The shock is meant to reset the heart's rhythm and help it start beating again.

It is not possible to repeatedly stop and start a person's heart using a defibrillator. Defibrillators are only used in emergency situations when the heart has stopped beating. They are not meant to be used on a regular basis or to control a person's heart rate.

As temperatures across the world continue to rise, farmers in Cambodia are struggling to keep their businesses afloat. A combination of volatile weather patterns, diminishing water resources, and increased pest and disease pressure due to climate change has put an immense strain on the country’s agricultural sector.

For farmers in the Southeast Asian nation, the situation is dire. Many have been unable to make ends meet due to poor yields and high input costs. Faced with mounting debts, many are taking extreme measures in the hope of surviving.

One increasingly popular tactic is taking out microfinance loans. In Cambodia, microfinance is the only formal source of credit for individuals who do not have access to traditional banking services. For farmers, these loans can be lifesavers, offering them the chance to purchase vital agricultural inputs like seeds, tools, and pesticides to help protect their crops from pests and disease.

The use of microfinance loans has become so common in Cambodia that the country has been dubbed the “Microfinance Capital of the World.” According to the World Bank, there are currently over 100 active microfinance institutions (MFI’s) operating in the country. 

However, while microfinance loans may be the only solution for some farmers, they come with a number of risks. MFI’s typically charge extremely high-interest rates, meaning that if farmers are not able to repay the loan, they can quickly find themselves in a worse financial situation than they were in before.

Unfortunately, this is a reality that many farmers in Cambodia are now facing. Despite their best efforts, many farmers are unable to pay back the loans they have taken out, putting them at risk of losing their livelihoods. 

As the effects of climate change continue to take their toll on the country’s agricultural sector, the situation is likely to worsen unless immediate action is taken. The government is making efforts to provide assistance to struggling farmers, including offering loan subsidies and helping to build agricultural infrastructure. 

However, if Cambodia is to truly protect its farmers and build resilience to climate change, much more needs to be done. In addition to government aid, it is essential that access to credit is made more affordable and accessible for farmers, so that they can secure the resources they need to protect their crops and their futures. 

The challenge of helping Cambodia’s farmers remains a daunting one. But if the country is to build a sustainable future, it is clear that greater investment in microfinance and other forms of support will be essential.

Koerner was born in Nebraska on June 24, 1907, and lived most of her life in Omaha. She later moved to Council Bluffs, Iowa, where she died.

"She was a loving and caring daughter, sister, mother, grandmother, great grandmother and great-great grandmother," her family said in a statement. "She was always willing to share her stories, advice and tales of the 'olden days.'"

Koerner worked for the Omaha Public Power District for 15 years before retiring in 1973. She then went on to become a crossing guard for the Council Bluffs Public School District for more than 10 years.

"My grandmother was an amazing woman," said her granddaughter, Liz Jameson. "She lived such a full and long life, and was an inspiration to us all. She will be deeply missed, but she will live on in our memories."

Koerner was believed to be the oldest living person in the United States, and the fourth-oldest in the world, according to the Gerontology Research Group.

At the time of her death, she was just two months shy of 116th birthday, which would have made her the oldest living person in the world.

Koerner is survived by her two sons, five grandchildren, 13 great-grandchildren, and three great-great grandchildren.

Her death comes just days after the death of Edna Parker, of Indiana, who was believed to be the oldest person in the world when she passed away in November at the age of 115.

Koerner and Parker are believed to have been the last of the few remaining people born in the 19th century.

Her death has drawn attention to the diminishing number of people born in the 1800s.

Koerner's death is a reminder of the importance of appreciating life and cherishing each day, her family said.

text: Production yields . When making a set , you have generally 2 sheets of glass with circuitry and semiconductors deposited between them . There are backups built - in to some aspects of this . The manufacturing is being done on a microscopic level , in clean rooms . But errors and mistakes in the process still happen , regularly . If there are enough mistakes on a screen , the manufacturer has to throw it out . The bigger the screen is , the higher chance that it will contain too many mistakes to become a finished product . The whole thing has to be scrapped . We call this the production yield . What percentage of screens we try to manufacture do we actually succeed at ? This is very high for small screens . 90%+ maybe for the tiny screens for cell phones . But it falls the bigger the screen gets . The longer you manufacture at a bigger size and the more experience you have with it , the better you can make your yield though . So not only do bigger screens cost more because they use more materials in them , they cost more because they are harder to successfully manufacture . More " duds " are produced that the manufacturer still paid to make , but is unable to sell .

La Fundación proporcionará ayuda, asesoramiento, guías y recursos destinados a ayudar a los desarrolladores de videojuegos a crear contenidos accesibles para todos.

text: When a country goes into default, it means that it is unable to pay its debts. This can happen if the country has taken out loans from other countries or international organizations, or if it has issued bonds (which are essentially IOUs) to investors. If the country cannot make the required payments on these debts, it is considered to be in default. There are different levels of default, ranging from a "technical default," which is a minor missed payment, to a "full-blown default," which is a complete failure to pay all of a country's debts. If the US were to go into default, it could have serious consequences for the country's economy and its reputation around the world. For example, the value of the US dollar could decline, leading to higher prices for imported goods and potentially causing inflation. Other countries and investors might also become hesitant to lend money to the US in the future, which could make it more difficult and expensive for the US to borrow money. In addition, the US's credit rating, which is a measure of its ability to pay its debts, could be downgraded, making it harder for the US to borrow money in the future at favorable rates.

text: The Defense of Marriage Act (DOMA) was a federal law in the United States that defined marriage as a legal union between one man and one woman. It was enacted in 1996 and was later struck down by the Supreme Court in 2013 in a case called United States v. Windsor. Before DOMA was struck down, same-sex couples were not recognized as married by the federal government. This meant that they were not eligible for the same rights and benefits as opposite-sex couples, including things like the ability to file joint tax returns, receive spousal social security benefits, and have their spouse be eligible for health insurance through their employer. The Supreme Court's ruling on DOMA means that the federal government must now recognize same-sex marriages in the same way that it recognizes opposite-sex marriages. This means that same-sex couples are now eligible for the same rights and benefits as opposite-sex couples, including things like filing joint tax returns, receiving spousal social security benefits, and having their spouse be eligible for health insurance through their employer. In simple terms, the ruling on DOMA means that same-sex couples now have the same rights as opposite-sex couples under federal law. text: Meditation is basically to be in the moment . Often , People think about yesterday or tomorrow , what they 're going to do later that day , how stupid it was to do X last week . They 're stuck in their thoughts . Or you see people on the bus listening to music and/or daydreaming . Now what you do when you meditate is that you become aware of the moment : You do n't give a fuck about all those annoying thoughts about yesterday or tomorrow or whatever . So basically you do n't think , although thoughts may still go through your head . Of course there are different approaches , sometimes you focus immensely on something ( often the breath ) which will use up all focus and therefore reduce thoughts , or you try to not - focus , where you feel and observe everything in and around you . And there are still even more approaches , for example some have to do with feelings ( try to imagine a person you do n't like and imagine you hug him / like him ) for improving compassion . It 's easy to start meditation , but it takes a while until you notice and feel what it 's about and what it does . In the beginning you just sit there and afterwards you might be disappointed because you 've expected more of it . I can still highly recommend to do it , start with 10 minutes a day , just sit down , stop actively thinking about things ( but do n't try to suppress thoughts which will inevitably come up , just ignore them ) and keep focusing on your breath . That 's it .

text: A brain tumor is an abnormal growth of cells in the brain. Tumors can be either benign (not cancerous) or malignant (cancerous). Benign tumors are not usually life-threatening, but they can still cause problems because they can press on and damage nearby brain tissue. Malignant tumors are cancerous and can spread to other parts of the body.  Brain tumors can be difficult to treat because the brain is a complex organ that controls many important functions of the body. The treatment of a brain tumor often depends on the size, location, and type of the tumor, as well as the age and overall health of the patient.  Brain tumors are not always deadly, but they can be serious and life-threatening. The prognosis (outlook) for a person with a brain tumor depends on a variety of factors, including the type and stage of the tumor, the person's age and overall health, and the effectiveness of the treatment. Some brain tumors can be completely cured with treatment, while others may be slowed down or managed with treatment to help the person live a longer, healthier life.  It's important to note that brain tumors are relatively rare, and most people with a headache or other symptoms that might be caused by a brain tumor do not actually have a brain tumor. If you are concerned about brain tumors or other health issues, it's important to talk to a doctor for proper evaluation and treatment.

text: A graph neural network (GNN) is a type of neural network that is designed to operate on graph-structured data, such as data that is represented using a graph data structure. Graphs are useful for representing relationships between different objects or entities, and GNNs are particularly well-suited for tasks that involve analyzing and making predictions about such relationships.    In a GNN, the nodes in the graph represent the objects or entities of interest, and the edges represent relationships between those objects. Each node in the graph is associated with a set of features or attributes, which may be learned or fixed, and the edges between nodes may also have associated features or weights. The GNN uses these features to learn patterns in the graph structure and make predictions or decisions based on those patterns.    GNNs have a wide range of applications, including social network analysis, recommendation systems, and protein-protein interaction prediction. They are also used in natural language processing, computer vision, and other areas where data can be represented using a graph structure.    There are many different types of GNNs, including convolutional neural networks (CNNs), recurrent neural networks (RNNs), and graph attention networks (GATs). The specific architecture of a GNN will depend on the nature of the graph data and the task at hand.

The news was a troubling sign for the U.S. economy, as the rise in unemployment for these two key demographics could put a strain on the economic recovery.

It was a magical night on the diamond as three of the biggest stars in the game made history at the inaugural 2023 Major League Baseball All-Star Game.

New York Yankees shortstop Troy Tulowitzki, Los Angeles Dodgers first baseman Adrian Gonzalez, and Philadelphia Phillies right fielder Bryce Harper all became the first players in MLB history to hit three home runs in a single All-Star Game.

The three players proved to be the difference-makers on a night that saw the American League win their first All-Star Game since 2015, defeating the National League by a score of 6-3.

It was Tulowitzki who got the party started with a solo blast in the second inning off former Phillies ace Cliff Lee, giving the AL a 1-0 lead. He followed that up with a two-run blast off left-hander Tony Cingrani in the fourth inning, putting the AL ahead 3-0.

Then in the sixth inning, the former Toronto Blue Jays slugger sent a 3-2 fastball from Dodgers closer Kenley Jansen into the right-field bleachers for his third round-tripper of the game. With that, he became the first player in All-Star Game history to hit three home runs.

Gonzalez and Harper also made history with their pair of long balls. Gonzalez connected in the third inning off Cubs right-hander Jason Hammel and in the seventh off Tigers right-hander Doug Fister.

Harper, who had gone 0-for-3 up to that point, put an exclamation point on the AL's victory with a two-run homer off Jansen in the ninth, his second in the game.

The three sluggers—each of whom is considered one of the most dynamic hitters of his generation—were all clearly thrilled with their historical night. After the game, all three players expressed their amazement at what they had accomplished.

"To be honest, I didn't think I'd be able to hit three home runs, let alone be the first person to do it," Tulowitzki said. "It was an incredible experience and I'm so thankful for the opportunity."

Gonzalez echoed his teammate's sentiment, saying, "It's really an honor to be mentioned in the same sentence with two of the best hitters of this era. It's a moment I'll never forget."

Harper, meanwhile, credited his teammates for motivating him to keep plugging away until he was able to break through.

"I just had to keep grinding and stay focused," he said. "My teammates kept encouraging me throughout the night and that definitely helped me stay in the zone. I can't thank them enough."

For the AL, the victory was especially sweet. After losing five straight All-Star Games, the American League finally broke through and secured the win thanks to the historic performances of Tulowitzki, Gonzalez, and Harper.

It was truly a night to remember in the annals of All-Star history. Three of the game's brightest stars shined on the biggest stage, cementing their legacy as some of the all-time greats. Three truly was a magic number, as these three players proved on this night.

text: Infinity is n't a number , it 's a concept . It 's very good at identifying how things behave ( tending to infinity , infinite area , etc . ) when you want a way to identify something as being bigger than any other number . However , what it does n't do well is to try and make it work into standard arithmetic . What , for example , is infinity plus 1 ? It ca n't be bigger than infinity because by definition , nothing is bigger than infinity so it has to be infinity . Infinity plus infinity ? That 's the definition of 2xinfinity , but that will be infinity too . So will 3xinfinity , 4xinfinity and also infinity^2 . Infinity minus infinity or infinity divided by infinity makes even less sense , because of these different " sizes " of infinity that are all treated as the same . On a more basic level , infinity is often defined by the limit of n / x where n is a real number and x tends to 0 . Crudely ( and inaccurately ) put , this can be simplified as n/0 = infinity . Reversing the multiplication gives that 0 x infinity = n where n is any real number . This is a horribly informal way of putting it though .

At the same time, those who suffer from DMG need to be aware of the real risks associated with prolonged and excessive mirror gazing. Additionally, those with DMG need to seek help from a mental health professional, as this condition can have serious negative impacts on their lives. text: The two terms are " climate change " and " global warming . " Global warming describes a warming effect on climate generally assumed to be the result of greenhouse gasses and anthropogenic impacts on the climate . The problem with the term global warming is that after the El Nino year in 1998 the earth went through ~10 years of no warming , perhaps slight cooling . All the science and predictions were that carbon emissions were driving the climate the warm , but this did n't happen and skeptics of the conventional wisdom pounced on it . So over time the term " climate change " became popularized to describe any change in climate caused by human interaction with the earth . If you are referring to human impacts that cause warming you can still be accurate and use the term global warming , but in most conversations the term climate change is more accurate because most conversations discuss more than just the warming of the earth .

Investing in sports teams is something a lot of people dream about, but for the few who have managed to pull it off, it often doesn’t pay off. That’s the case for the new owners of some of the world’s top soccer clubs.

A few of the most high-profile acquisitions in sports over the last decade have been of European soccer giants, with owners of clubs like Manchester United, Real Madrid, and Paris Saint-Germain all spending hundreds of millions of dollars in the pursuit of glory. But the benefits of these investments have been highly variable, with some teams seeing huge increases in value while others have not seen any returns at all.

Take, for example, Manchester United, one of the most famous soccer clubs in the world. Its current owner, American business magnate, Joel Glazer, bought it in 2005 for £790 million ($1.07 billion). However, after more than a decade, the club’s estimated value stands at only £2.21 billion ($2.97 billion) — a mere £430 million ($571 million) more than what Glazer paid for it.

Or take Paris Saint-Germain, the French club bought by Qatar Sports Investments in 2011 for an estimated £130 million ($173 million). Over the years, their value has skyrocketed to an estimated £2.36 billion ($3.16 billion) — a huge return on investment of over £2 billion ($2.66 billion).

The reasons why some teams have seen such huge returns while others haven’t vary greatly. Manchester United’s lack of profitability was largely attributed to its huge wage bill, which had to be reduced substantially following Glazer’s takeover. Meanwhile, Qatar’s approach to Paris Saint-Germain was very different, with huge investments in both players and infrastructure, which has made the team hugely successful and more attractive to sponsors.

The trend of investors buying top-tier European soccer teams is unlikely to slow down any time soon. There are numerous incentives for wealthy individuals or organizations to purchase clubs, from the cachet of owning one of the world’s most recognizable teams to the potential rewards of running a successful business. But it’s important to remember that investing in soccer doesn’t always pay off. And with the costs of running a team continuing to rise, it’s becoming increasingly difficult for new owners to make a profit. 

At the end of the day, buying a soccer club is like any other investment. For the lucky few, it may pay off. But for many more, it’s likely to be a costly endeavor with little in terms of returns.

text:
The global economy has been stuck in a prolonged period of low inflation for more than a decade now, but analysts are increasingly pointing to signs that the trend may soon be reversing course. This is potentially good news for investors who have recently been shying away from bonds, as higher levels of inflation could make them more attractive investments.

The global economic recovery from the 2020 pandemic shock has been notable for its weak inflationary pressures, as central banks have kept policy loose and fiscal stimulus has failed to gain much traction. But as vaccine rollouts pick up pace and more countries are able to return to normal, analysts are expecting to see a gradual re-emergence of inflation.

As inflation begins to pick up, so too may the appeal of bonds to investors. After all, they tend to benefit from rising inflation expectations, since higher inflation means higher yields on longer-dated bonds. This relationship has been weakened by central bank action in recent years, but if inflation continues to rise, then this could offer an opportunity for investors looking for yield.

One area of the bond market that could benefit particularly from higher inflation is the “roughed-up” bond play. These are bonds that have been sold off over the past year or so as the economic outlook has worsened and investors have become more risk-averse. High-yield bonds have been especially hard hit, as companies have seen their revenues suffer due to the pandemic.

However, these bonds may now be an attractive proposition for investors, as their prices may start to recover should inflation expectations begin to pick up. This is especially true for longer-dated high-yield bonds, which are exposed to higher levels of inflation risk than shorter-dated bonds. This means that investors may be able to reap the rewards of higher yields, as well as benefit from any upside to the prices of these bonds, should they recover.

Of course, the risks of investing in these roughed-up bond plays cannot be ignored. They are high-risk investments, and can result in losses if the inflation backdrop fails to materialize or if the economic recovery takes a downward turn. Nonetheless, these bonds may present a potentially attractive option for investors looking for yield, and for those willing to take on the risk of a roughed-up bond play, it could be an opportunity worth considering.

text: A player is said to be in an offside position if they are simultaneously : 1 . In their opponents half of the pitch . 2 . In front of the ball ( ie . nearer to the opposition goal line than the ball is ) . 3 . There are fewer than two opposition players between the player and the opposition goal line . A player in an offside position is not necessarily committing an offence unless they become ' active ' by touching the ball or preventing an opposing player from playing the ball . None of the above applies when a team is taking a corner kick or a throw - in . These rules apply at the time when the ball was last played . Therefore a player can run from an onside position to an offside position and legally receive the ball , as long as they were onside when it was played . edit : Confused the FIFA rule about ' gaining an advantage from being in an offside position ' , removed the errant statement .

Association rule learning is a rule-based machine learning method for discovering interesting relations between variables in large databases. It is intended to identify strong rules discovered in databases using some measures of interestingness. In any given transaction with a variety of items, association rules are meant to discover the rules that determine how or why certain items are connected.
Based on the concept of strong rules, Rakesh Agrawal, Tomasz Imieliński and Arun Swami introduced association rules for discovering regularities between products in large-scale transaction data recorded by point-of-sale (POS) systems in supermarkets. For example, the rule

In addition to the above example from market basket analysis association rules are employed today in many application areas including Web usage mining, intrusion detection, continuous production, and bioinformatics. In contrast with sequence mining, association rule learning typically does not consider the order of items either within a transaction or across transactions.

It was a year of joys and sorrows for Warren Buffett in 2022. The Oracle of Omaha saw his Berkshire Hathaway conglomerate outdo the S&P 500 for the first time in six years and ranked as the world's third-richest person, but he watched helplessly as Berkshire's stock price dropped and the pandemic wore on. 

But Buffett was still his usual talking self. The billionaire investor found plenty of time to deliver colorful quotes on a variety of topics, from stock-market gambling to bitcoin and his admiration for Tesla's Elon Musk and Amazon's Jeff Bezos.

So, here is a look back at 10 of Warren Buffett's best quotes of 2022:

1. On stock-market gambling: “You know, the stock market is a great place to go if you have the ability to be rational and can look at long-term results. But it is a terrible place for the gambler, and most people don’t have the discipline to stay away from it.”

2. On Bitcoin: "It's a delusion, basically. In terms of cryptocurrencies, generally, I can say with almost certainty that they will come to a bad ending."

3. On Elon Musk and Jeff Bezos: "These two incredible individuals [Musk and Bezos] have done a tremendous job… They have disrupted industry after industry and they haven't been stopped yet."

4. On Investing: “No matter how great the talent or effort, some things just take time. You can't produce a baby in one month by getting nine women pregnant."

5. On Berkshire’s Stock Price: "The stock market is an ever-ending story of buyers and sellers, and it has no conscience. Its job is to make all of us—except insiders—as uncertain as possible."

6. On Reinvesting: "The stocks we tend to sell are those that are doing better than what I want to own in the long term, and that I believe are overvalued or underpriced. A company that is truly underpriced should be left alone—not sold—so the market can eventually recognize its true worth."

7. On Growing Berkshire: "Berkshire has become increasingly large and likely to grow even more. That size brings substantial advantages in some areas and disadvantages in others. But size will not be our undoing: Our aversion to leveraged, fashionable and high-priced investments will be.”

8. On the Future: “Someone is sitting in the shade today because someone planted a tree a long time ago.”

9. On Humility: “If you don't find yourself questioning your opinions and trying to find flaws in them, you're not thinking. We're always looking for reasons not to do something.”

10. On Overconfidence: “You always have to be prepared for the unexpected. Overconfidence kills.”

Buffett’s words of wisdom never cease to inspire investors and everyday people alike. His candid insights and humor are refreshing, especially in a world where it’s hard to come by. Let’s take his words to heart and apply them to our lives in the coming year.
