Pope Joseph Ratzinger, the former pontiff known as Pope Benedict XVI, died on April 2 at the age of 93, leaving a legacy of innovation and reform, but also an enduring legacy of controversy regarding the Catholic Church’s response to decades of sexual abuse.

Ratzinger was appointed pope in April 2005 after the death of his predecessor, Pope John Paul II. Ratzinger assumed the name Benedict XVI in honor of two of his predecessors, Pope Benedict XV and Pope Benedict XIV, who both used the name during their papal tenures. He was the first German pope in centuries and the oldest man to ever ascend to the papacy at 78 years old.

During his papacy, Ratzinger was responsible for crafting and promoting new theological directives and building bridges with other Christian denominations. He was a vocal proponent of church teachings on abortion, contraception and same-sex relationships. He also worked to re-energize the papacy’s diplomatic efforts, participating in regular meetings with representatives of other religions and engaging in highly public visits abroad.

Ratzinger faced criticism over the Catholic Church’s handling of the sexual abuse crisis. In 2001, as Prefect of the Congregation for the Doctrine of the Faith, the office he held until his election as Pope, Ratzinger issued a letter asserting that sexual abuse of minors by priests was a “particularly grave delict”. He suggested that bishops could avoid costly civil litigation by using church tribunals to prosecute such cases. Critics argued that Ratzinger should have done more to make known the Church’s position against sexual abuse and that his directive shifted responsibility onto the local bishops, rather than the Vatican.

Ratzinger frequently expressed his own sorrow for the suffering caused by the crisis, and in 2012 he issued a statement to the world’s Catholics that expressed his “profound grief” at the “unspeakable criminal acts” committed by priests. “I am deeply ashamed,” he said, “and we will do what is possible so that this cannot happen again.”

Throughout his papacy, Ratzinger sought to re-connect the Church with its doctrinal traditions and intellectual foundations. He initiated major reform efforts in areas such as liturgy, ecumenical dialogue and the Church’s relationship with the modern world, further elucidating the Church’s teaching on matters such as bioethics and marriage. During his time as pope, Ratzinger granted more than 1,000 interviews and authored several books that defended and clarified Catholic teachings on faith and morals.

In the wake of his death, tributes to Ratzinger have poured in from across the globe, with many commentators noting that he was a deeply devout and intellectual man who made a positive impact on the Church and on society. Whatever the complicated legacy of his papacy, it remains clear that Ratzinger made a lasting impression on the Catholic Church.

text:
As the end of the year approaches and Americans start to think about their taxes, many will be considering making charitable donations for 2020. Giving to charity has numerous benefits — it helps those in need, it can reduce your taxable income, and it can even be done in a way that maximizes tax savings. 

In the wake of COVID-19 and its devastating economic effects, giving to charity has become more important than ever. According to Giving USA’s 2020 report, donations to charity in the United States dropped by 3.9% in 2020. Additionally, the IRS reported that tax deductions for charitable contributions fell by 7.5% between 2017 and 2018. This means that donations to charity are more important now than ever before.

For those who are considering making a charitable donation this year, there are two of the “best” ways to do it in order to maximize your tax deduction. The first way is to donate cash. Cash donations are the most efficient way to donate to charity and are also the most tax efficient. You can deduct up to 60% of your adjusted gross income for cash donations and the deduction can be taken in the tax year the donation is made. 

The second way to donate to maximize your tax deduction is to donate appreciated stock. When you donate appreciated stock, you are not only allowed to deduct the full market value of the stock, but you are also exempt from paying capital gains tax on the appreciation. This means that you can deduct the full market value of the stock without having to pay any taxes on the gains that you have made. 

These are two of the best ways to donate to maximize your tax deduction. Additionally, there are other methods of donating to charity that you can use, such as donating property, donating IRA assets, or setting up a Donor Advised Fund. It’s important to speak to a financial advisor or tax professional to determine which method will work best for your individual situation. 

When donating to charity, it is important to remember to itemize your deductions and save all receipts and other documents related to your donation. Additionally, it is important to make sure you are giving to a legitimate charity — this is especially true if you are considering donating to a relief organization or a crowdfunding site. You should always do your research to ensure that the organization or individual is legitimate and that your donation will be used for the purpose that you intend. 

Giving to charity is a great way to reduce your taxable income and help those in need. As the year comes to a close and taxes are on everyone’s mind, consider making a charitable donation to maximize your tax deduction. With the right approach, you can give to charity, reduce your taxable income, and help those in need.

text:
For Kansas Attorney General-elect Kris Kobach, a long, controversial campaign season is finally over. On Tuesday, the Federal Election Commission (FEC) announced it had fined Kobach's 2020 U.S. Senate campaign more than $1.2 million for accepting excessive campaign contributions and failing to accurately report donations.

The FEC found that Kobach, who received the most votes in Kansas in the Republican primary, accepted nearly $1.4 million in contributions over the legal limit for his primary and general election campaigns. Kobach, who lost the general election in November to Senator Roger Marshall, was also accused of failing to accurately disclose political committee disbursements and donations in violation of federal campaign finance laws.

In a statement released Tuesday, Kobach said he was "sorry" for the violations and vowed to "abide by FEC regulations going forward."

"I acknowledge that the FEC has made a reasonable determination in this case. I regret any mistakes my campaign may have made, and will make sure that going forward, the FEC's regulations are followed," Kobach said.

Kobach's campaign was also accused of illegally coordinating with a super PAC, the Committee to Defend the President, which spent millions of dollars on his behalf. The FEC dismissed those charges, but the U.S. Department of Justice is still pursuing a separate investigation into potential violations.

The FEC also fined two of Kobach's political consultants for failing to properly report the campaign's spending and other activities.

Kobach, who served as Kansas Secretary of State from 2011 to 2019, was an early supporter of Donald Trump's 2016 presidential campaign and was an advisor to the former president during his term. Kobach has been an outspoken advocate of Trump's hardline immigration policies and played a leading role in the administration's voter fraud commission.

But his hardline positions on immigration and voting rights have also drawn criticism from many in the Republican Party. His opponents in the Kansas primary, including businessman and eventual winner of the Republican nomination Roger Marshall, criticized Kobach for not doing enough to bring people into the Republican fold.

The fines come as a major setback to Kobach's political career, which had been gaining steam heading into 2022. He was a favorite to run for governor of Kansas, and his name had been floated as a potential candidate for the 2024 Republican presidential nomination.

Kobach, who is due to assume office as the state's top law enforcement official on January 8, may face additional penalties in the future, depending on the outcome of the Justice Department investigation.

Kobach is the latest high-profile politician to be fined by the FEC for campaign finance violations. In December, South Carolina Senator Lindsey Graham was fined $140,000 for making false statements to the commission.

Natural gas prices across Europe have reached pre-Ukraine War levels, according to a report published this morning by the energy research firm Platts.

The news is a sign that European markets are emerging from a volatile period of instability, as well as providing a boost to gas producers in the region.

At the height of the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, Russia cut off natural gas supplies to Europe in an effort to gain leverage over the dispute. This caused natural gas prices across the continent to spike, as countries scrambled to find alternative sources of fuel.

The sharp increase in prices prompted many European countries to look for new ways to reduce their reliance on Russian natural gas and invest in alternative sources of energy. This led to a rapid expansion of renewable energy projects, as well as increased investment in shale gas exploration.

At the same time, negotiations between the European Union and Russia over the supply of natural gas continued. While the initial agreement was not implemented, a subsequent deal finally brought natural gas supplies back online.

The agreement also provided some stability to the European energy markets, and Platts now reports that natural gas prices have returned to their pre-war levels. While there are still occasional fluctuations in prices, the overall trend is positive.

The stability in the European natural gas markets has also been welcomed by producers in the region. The restored confidence in supplies has encouraged several companies to invest in new projects, including exploration for shale gas and a number of renewable energy initiatives.

The news is also good news for European consumers, as the reduction in prices will help reduce their energy bills.

In addition, the news could also provide a boost to the European economy, as increased investment in energy infrastructure could lead to job creation and economic growth.

For now, it appears that European energy markets are beginning to return to pre-Ukraine War levels, and this is a welcome sign that the region is finally emerging from a turbulent period. 

The developments have been welcomed by many in the energy industry, as well as by consumers and governments across the continent. While the immediate effects may be limited, the restored stability in energy prices could be just the beginning of a period of sustained economic growth. 

However, it is important to note that the situation remains fragile and the European energy markets could still be affected by the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine. 

Only time will tell whether European natural gas prices will remain stable in the long-term. In the meantime, the news of today is certainly a positive one for Europe's energy markets.

text: Think of a large SUV moving on a narrow street . Technically , the SUV is free to move in 2D dimensions : forwards / backwards and left / right . But if the street is very narrow compared to the SUV , it ca n't , in practical terms , move left / right . Essentially , its movement is constrained to 1D , despite it existing on a 2D surface . If the SUV were a creature , it would 've evolved without the ability to sense the second dimension . For contrast , a motorcycle is small enough to be able to manoeuvre on the narrow street , so it can feel the two dimensions . Essentially , string theory proposes 3 " large " space dimensions , one time dimension , and extra " small " space dimensions . * We * ca n't interact with the extra dimensions , but small particles can . If these dimensions exist , we would observe extra particles with different masses but otherwise identical the ones we already know ; in truth , these are n't extra new particles but the same old ones moving differently across the small dimensions . These extra particles have never been observed .

text: A ranked voting system is a way of casting and counting votes in an election where voters are able to rank the candidates in order of preference. Instead of just choosing one candidate, voters can indicate their top choice, second choice, third choice, and so on.In a ranked voting system, if a candidate wins a majority of first-choice votes, they are declared the winner just like in a normal election. If no candidate wins a majority of first-choice votes, then the candidate with the fewest votes is eliminated and their votes are redistributed to the voters' next choice. This process is repeated until one candidate has a majority of votes and is declared the winner.One advantage of ranked voting is that it can help ensure that the winner of an election has the support of a majority of voters, rather than just a plurality of voters. In a normal election, it is possible for a candidate to win with less than 50% of the vote if there are more than two candidates running. In a ranked voting system, this is less likely to happen because the votes of the least popular candidate can be redistributed to the voters' next choice.As for how a ranked voting system could help eliminate the two-party system, it's important to note that ranked voting is just one of many potential reforms that could help encourage more political diversity. However, ranked voting could potentially help by making it easier for third-party candidates or independent candidates to win elections. Since voters are able to rank multiple candidates in order of preference, they can choose to support a third-party candidate as their first choice while still expressing a preference for one of the major party candidates as their second choice. This could make it more likely that a third-party candidate could win an election, or at least have a stronger influence on the outcome.

text:
India’s utility vehicle sales rose in December, bucking a trend of sluggishness in the automotive industry, but demand for entry-level cars remained muted due to weak consumer sentiment and tight credit conditions.

According to industry data, utility vehicle sales in India rose 3.7% to 294,146 units in December from 283,918 units a year earlier, while the sale of passenger cars fell 8% to 207,530 units.

The utility vehicle segment has been the lone bright spot in the Indian automotive industry, which is mired in its longest slump in nearly two decades. The segment includes SUVs, multi-purpose vehicles and vans, and has grown about 11% this financial year.

The December sales figures released by the Society of Indian Automobile Manufacturers (SIAM) suggest that domestic automakers are focusing more on utility vehicles, despite a lack of demand for passenger cars. The main beneficiaries have been the country’s leading automakers, Maruti Suzuki, Mahindra & Mahindra and Tata Motors.

“The demand for utility vehicles is more resilient than passenger cars,” said Vishnu Mathur, director general of SIAM. He said the segment has benefited from the consumer shift towards convenience and safety, as well as a stronger rural demand.

SIAM attributed the weak passenger car sales to a fall in consumer sentiment, tight credit conditions and a lack of new launches.

“It has been an extremely challenging year for the auto industry,” Mathur said. “Demand for passenger cars remains weak, and industry players have been struggling to sustain sales despite a series of cost-cutting measures.”

The slump has been so severe that automakers had to resort to steep discounts and cut production. In November, the industry had announced it would reduce production by 10-15%, or about 400,000 units a month.

The slowdown in India’s automotive sector has had a ripple effect on other industries as well. The industry accounts for about half of the country’s total output of industrial parts and components.

On a positive note, Mathur said the SIAM expected an improvement in demand in the coming months, driven by the government’s stimulus package and the festival season.

“We expect the situation to improve with the launch of new models and the roll-out of the government’s economic stimulus package,” he said. “The festive season could also act as a catalyst for growth.”

Analysts believe the improvement in consumer sentiment will be key to bringing about a revival in the auto sector.

“The consumer sentiment needs to improve for passenger cars to come back into the market,” said Deepak Jain, a research analyst at brokerage firm Edelweiss. “As of now, the industry is relying solely on the utility vehicle segment to keep it afloat.”

For now, the industry will have to make do with the limited demand, while awaiting a turnaround.

The survey also found that Chinese millionaires and billionaires are increasingly investing in foreign companies, especially those in Europe and the United States.

The survey found that wealthy Chinese are also looking to invest in new technologies, such as artificial intelligence and fintech, as well as investing in venture capital and private equity.

text: The movement of images -- and by images I mean any kind of pictures on the screen : icons , mouse cursor , scrolling text , anything -- involves having some part of some computer program draw things on the screen . It not only has to draw the thing it 's moving , something has to draw the things it is moving over ; for instance , if you 're moving your mouse cursor over a window with text , something has to redraw the text that was underneath the cursor after it moves away . When your computer " freezes " it just means that the program(s ) drawing this stuff have quit drawing it . It could mean that the program(s ) are in a loop doing something else , and can not get back to the part that redraws . It could mean that the program has crashed entirely , in a way that leaves the image it was responsible for where it was but not update it . This is why sometimes you see images from one program remain on a ( Windows ) screen even though other things are working . In these cases , if you take a different program window , cover the image with the new one , and then take it away , the part that you covered will then have the ' frozen ' window erased and whatever was supposed to be under it then displayed .

text:
The U.S. economy is entering a rough patch as brand-name companies, many of whom had defied the pandemic recession up until now, announce staggering levels of white-collar layoffs.

Just in the last week, Uber, IBM, Microsoft, Apple and McDonald's have all joined the ranks of the layoffs.

The news has been troubling for many, as the workforce remains particularly vulnerable amid the economic uncertainty of the coronavirus pandemic.

For businesses, the economic slowdown has meant a sobering recalibration of labor. With revenues slumping and demands for goods and services decreasing, companies have to adjust their costs to remain viable.

With the surging unemployment rate, the affected employees are facing an uncertain future. Some are struggling to get their finances in order, while others may be forced to shift career paths.

Uber, which began its layoffs this week, is one of the largest companies to announce a workforce reduction since the coronavirus pandemic began. The rideshare company cited the need to “align its organization to better serve riders and drivers” as the reason behind the cuts, which will affect some 3,000 employees.

IBM said it would eliminate up to 10,000 jobs worldwide, with most of the losses hitting the United States and India, two of the firm's largest markets. Microsoft, the world's largest software maker, is also shedding up to 5,000 jobs due to the pandemic.

Apple, a tech giant, is cutting 11,000 jobs from its retail stores in 30 countries due to reduced consumer spending. Meanwhile, McDonald’s has announced it will be eliminating 3,500 positions across its corporate offices, although it did not specify exactly how many of those are corporate layoffs.

The layoffs come amid a broader economy-wide shakeup. According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, 10.7 million jobs have been lost since the coronavirus pandemic began in March 2020, with the hardest-hit sectors including hospitality, retail and leisure.

Though some sectors are rehiring, others are continuing to struggle. Businesses are scaling back their operations and significantly reducing their workforce as they try to cope with the sudden downturn.

The job losses are likely to leave long-lasting repercussions. In addition to the direct impacts, economists say the layoffs could result in a cascading effect, creating a ripple of economic pain throughout the economy.

The layoffs also come as consumer confidence continues to fall. The Conference Board, an industry research group, said consumer confidence dropped to its lowest level in the past four years in December, hitting a nine-year low for the month.

The downward spiral of job cuts and consumer spending has left analysts worried about a sustained economic slowdown in the near future.

In addition to the white-collar layoffs, companies are beginning to make their own austerity measures, such as wage freezes and reduced work hours, in order to save costs.

Despite some signs of economic recovery, the wave of white-collar layoffs paints a worrying picture for the future. With the economic outlook still uncertain, the pressure on businesses to survive is only growing.

text: 5,000 years ago humans did n't know much about metal , metalworking , geology , or mining . But they did have a sense for fashion . Most metals exist naturally as rock . The metal atoms are connected to other kinds of elements like silicon and they do n't look very interesting ( to a non - geologist ) . In the world before the Bronze Age , the only metals most humans would recognize were silver and gold . Gold can be found as " nuggets " or " dust " . The processes that bring it to the surface tends to deposit it in veins so that if you find some , you 're likely to find more . Typically it is exposed by weather and flushed downhill into rivers , so finding gold means finding a river with some gold or silver in it , and then looking for more - you do n't have to mine it . You can work gold without heat . It is " malleable " at room temperature , which means you can whack on it with hammers to change the shape of a lump of gold and bend it with tongs - and even though it is malleable it wo n't lose its new shape once you finish working it and that means you can make useful things . Gold will not hold an edge so it is useless as a blade . It is much denser than most other materials so it would make a good club , but you do n't get much more head - bashing advantage with a gold cub than you would with stone or even wood . So other than as jewelry and as decoration , gold has little practical " use " to an ancient human . But it is pretty . Aesthetically gold looks " good " next to human skin tones . Why this is so is pretty much a mystery . But it 's obvious that people found gold attractive very very early in human development . Who gets jewelry ? Rich people . In the ancient world " rich " was defined as " do n't have to farm " . There were only three kinds of people like that : royalty , high priests , and successful generals . Since gold was in limited supply - but there was enough of it that people would recognize it and value it , and it was n't good for any practical use , and as a metal it would " stay all in one place " and did n't have to be kept in jars or otherwise contained , it became a way for rich people to display their wealth . Gold is pretty easy to purify and to determine purity ( it 's a simple weight / volume calculation ) . That means that it could be exchanged between people for like value - a fixed amount of gold , of a certain purity , was " worth " some number of sheep or sheaves of wheat , or slaves , or land , or whatever . It became a unit of currency due to intrinsic properties convenient for anyone to access - all I need is a scale , a cup , some water , and a little math and I can figure out how much your gold is worth to me . 5,000 years of humans accepting gold as valuable has imbued it with a certain advantage vs. other similar metals . Nobody wants to exchange plutonium coins , even though plutonium is worth , ounce for ounce , vastly more than gold . Gold turns out to have practical uses for modern humans that ancient humans did n't know about - it 's an extraordinarily good conductor of electricity . And it still looks good next to human skin .

For more than 80 years, Pelé has been an indelible symbol of joy, resilience, and global brotherhood. He captured the imaginations of generations of football fans around the world with his daring, acrobatic style and his enormous on-field success. As of 2023, Pele's health had deteriorated significantly due to advanced age, and his family announced the inevitable last week, sending the world into mourning.

Today, Brazilians celebrated the life and legacy of the King of Football with a lavish wake and a spectacular coffin procession that drew tens of thousands of people to the Sambodrome in Rio de Janeiro, as well as over a million others who followed the procession online. The day-long tribute began with a 21-gun salute honoring Pelé and ended with a stirring mass celebration featuring some of Brazil's most iconic music, dancing, and performance art.

Pelé's family and closest friends paid their respects with a brief and poignant vigil inside the Sambodrome. His sons and grandchildren, alongside a special selection of football legends, carried his coffin to a stage in the center of the arena, where it was decorated with mementos from Pelé's life and career. As traditional drums echoed through the stadium and fireworks lit up the night sky, a large crowd of mourners surrounded Pelé's body and sang the classic Brazilian anthem in his honor.

After a few hours of celebration, Pelé's coffin was put into a specially-made hearse and taken on a journey through the city of Rio. Thousands of people lined the streets and bridges to watch and pay their respects as the procession made its way to the Maracanã Stadium, where Pele scored his 1,000th goal and a plaque bearing his name and nickname, "O Rei (the King)" remains today.

At Maracanã, the coffin procession paused so that Pele's friends, family, and fans could once again gather around his casket in solemn respect. A giant Brazilian flag hung in the stadium, symbolizing Pelé's vast legacy and the deep impact he left on Brazilian culture. 

Eventually, the procession moved onward, eventually coming to rest in a small village just outside Rio. There, a small ceremony marked the last stop of the journey and Pelé's remains were buried in a special plot of land beneath a bronze sculpture of the three-time World Cup champion. Throughout the day, the citizens of the village toasted with caipirinhas, a Brazilian cocktail, in honor of their nation's King of Football. 

As the sun set on what was an emotional day for Brazilians, the citizens of Rio and beyond looked to the sky and thanked Pelé for the memories and inspiration he brought to the world. Pelé made football a game of dreams and joy and, in the process, united a nation and changed lives forever. His remarkable impact won't be forgotten.

So, here's to you, Pelé. Thanks for the memories and may you rest in peace.

It’s been years since the United States and other developed nations felt the bite of inflation, but a surge in prices in the second half of 2021 has sparked renewed talk of a transitory inflation spike. The discussion has intensified in recent weeks after an unexpectedly high increase in the consumer price index (CPI) in October, with many economists warning that the long-term effects of the pandemic could mean higher prices are here to stay.

“I’m getting a lot of questions about transitory inflation,” said Kris Koester, an economist at JPMorgan Chase. “There’s some evidence that prices are rising, but whether or not it’s transitory or something more lasting is very much up for debate.”

The surge in prices has been driven by a combination of forces. The first is the heavy spending the government and consumers have engaged in throughout the pandemic. This has been felt most acutely in the retail sector, as an increased demand for goods and services has pushed up prices.

At the same time, shortages of key goods, especially semiconductors and shipping containers, have tightened up supply, driving up prices even further.

But not all economists are convinced the current price increases are just a blip. “I think this could be more than just a transitory inflation spike,” said Christian Lawrence, an economist at the Federal Reserve Bank of New York. “It’s possible that some of the factors pushing up prices, such as the increased demand for goods and services or the supply disruptions, could become more entrenched.”

That could lead to a “persistent rise” in inflation, he said.

In the long term, the effects of the pandemic could further drive up prices. Many businesses are operating under new costs and constraints that could lead to higher prices for goods and services, such as changes to labor laws or higher taxes.

And the massive increase in government spending could also have an impact on prices, as it has the potential to stimulate the economy and push up wages.

The Federal Reserve has been closely monitoring the situation and is expected to take action if it looks like inflation is taking hold. The central bank is already well into a program of quantitative easing and has recently talked of a possible tapering of its bond-buying program.

It could also raise interest rates, but this is unlikely to happen soon given the fragile economic recovery.

The Fed also has tools it can use to temper inflation if it does start to rise, such as decreasing the money supply or raising reserve requirements for banks.

Regardless of the exact cause, many economists are convinced that higher prices will be with us for some time. That means consumers could be in for a period of higher prices and businesses will need to adjust their pricing accordingly to remain competitive.

Typically, a customer would have to go to the dealership and test drive a car, negotiate the purchase and price, and then take the car home. The data from electric cars can also be used to help car companies better understand customer preferences and driving habits.

The increasing use of self-driving technology has also had an effect on the car buying process. Consumers are now able to purchase cars that can drive themselves and don’t require a driver’s license. In some cities, autonomous cars are even being tested on public roads. This shift in technology is leading car companies to re-think the way they do business.

Another way the car buying process has changed is through the use of artificial intelligence (AI). AI can be used to make recommendations to customers based on their preferences, budget and lifestyle. AI can also predict the best prices for customers and even negotiate on their behalf.

The biggest change, however, is the move towards subscription models. Instead of buying a car outright, customers are now able to rent cars on a short-term or long-term basis. This type of model allows consumers to get the car they want without having to worry about the upfront cost of buying a car.

All of these changes have had a major impact on the car buying process and how dealerships operate. Car companies are beginning to focus on online presence and customer service to attract customers and keep them coming back. They are also investing heavily in technologies such as AI, self-driving cars, and subscription models to make sure they stay competitive.

Een foto van drie bekendheden samen is deze week het gesprek van de stad. De foto toont actrice Angelina Jolie, Shiloh Jolie-Pitt en de Ierse acteur Paul Mescal gezellig koffie drinken.

De foto is gemaakt door een voorbijganger die voorbijkwam terwijl het trio zich zat voor een kopje koffie in het centrum van L.A. de foto toont de kinderen van Angelina Jolie die samen met Mescal bezig zijn met het verzamelen van de laatste details van de ontmoeting.

De ontmoeting is verrassend en nog niemand weet wat er gebeurd is tijdens de samenkomst. Sommige mensen gaan er vanuit dat Shiloh haar gezelschap invroeg omdat ze bevriend zijn met Mescal, omdat hij in haar klas op school zit.

Angelina Jolie en Paul Mescal hebben de afgelopen jaren samengewerkt aan verschillende filmprojecten, waaronder het komende drama dat volgend jaar uitkomt.

De twee hebben in deze periode vaak samengewerkt op de set en de samenwerking is blijkbaar positief verlopen. Een bron vertelde aan verschillende media dat de twee "heel professioneel met elkaar omgingen" tijdens de filmopnames.

Sinds deze foto gedeeld werd, zijn er veel speculaties ontstaan over wat er zou zijn tussen de twee. Er is nog niemand die iets definitiefs heeft gezegd, dus alle theorieën gaan rond over wat er tussen de twee is of kan zijn.

Natuurlijk heeft Jolie altijd de neiging gehad om haar persoonlijke leven geheim te houden, dus dat maakt het moeilijker om te weten wat er precies gaande is.

Niemand kan met zekerheid zeggen wat er zal gebeuren. We zullen allemaal gewoon moeten afwachten wat de twee gaat onthullen.

De fans van Jolie hopen dat de twee onlangs gespotte koffiedate betekent dat er meer tussen de twee gaande is. Maar als je Angelina Jolie kent, zal ze geen haast maken om informatie over haar persoonlijke leven bekend te maken.

Het blijft dus afwachten wat er gaat gebeuren tussen de twee. Wat we wel weten is dat er op dit moment een heleboel speculaties gaande zijn en de fans van Jolie zich afvragen of er meer gaat gebeuren tussen de twee.

text: They 're not loopholes . That 's just a propaganda word people use to confuse things . There are basically two different things that people sometimes erroneously call loopholes : There are tax deductions , and then there are standard accounting practices . A tax deduction is anything that you can * spend * money on that * reduces * your taxable income . So say you 're an individual — this applies equally well to corporations ; we 're just keeping it simple — who earns $ 100,000 in a year . You spend a quarter of that , let 's say , on * stuff * , stuff like your mortgage and food and whatever . That leaves you with $ 75,000 at the end of the year . Let 's * pretend * — this is not how it works , but this is just an example — that your tax rate is a flat 10 % of your taxable income , and your taxable income is everything you make in a year . That means in this year , your taxable income is $ 100,000 , and ten percent of that is $ 10,000 , meaning at the end of the year you owe the government $ 10,000 , out of the $ 75,000 you have on hand . But the government allows you to * deduct * charitable contributions from your taxable income . Meaning anything you give to charity is * subtracted from * your taxable income for the year . Since you have $ 75,000 left over at the end of the year , you can write a $ 50,000 check to your local soup kitchen , let 's say . That $ 50,000 gets * subtracted * from your taxable income , making your taxable income just $ 50,000 , rather than $ 100,000 . Since your tax is 10 % of your taxable income , you just reduced your tax bill from $ 10,000 to $ 5,000 , which is only 5 % of your gross income . Some people just look at the last sentence — you only paid 5 % of your gross income in taxes — and think that 's unfair , so they call deductions a loophole . In truth , we give tax deductions * hoping people will take advantage of them . * They 're * incentives * to get people to do certain things with their money , things like give to charity , or save for their retirement or future health - care needs , or put a kid through college . The other thing people sometimes mistakenly call " loopholes " are just standard accounting practices . One thing that 's been in the news kind of recently is the question of personal income from hedge fund managers . A hedge fund is a type of investment that 's managed by a person . That person does n't get paid a salary ; instead , he gets a percentage of the profits the hedge fund makes under his management . Makes sense , right ? You 're tying the manager 's compensation directly to his job performance . Well , since the hedge fund manager draws no salary and instead takes a percentage from the fund 's gain , all his income is taxed at the capital gains tax rate of 15 % , not at the income tax rate of ( up to ) 35 % . Some people call this a loophole , but that 's just propaganda . Accounting for your income that way is what you 're * supposed to do . * It 's not a cheat . It 's how the system is set up . We can talk about whether the system * should be * set up that way or not , but the fact is that * is * how the system is set up , and the hedge fund manager who reports his income as capital gain is following the rules . If he did it any * other * way he 'd be * breaking * the rules , and he 'd get in trouble for it . So basically , whenever you hear somebody say " tax loophole " , understand that they 're almost certainly talking about things that are built into the system for good reason and which people do because they 're supposed to . The phrase does * not * imply that people are cheating the system and getting away with it ; it 's just supposed make you * think * it implies that , so you can get mad at those dirty cheats … who are in reality just doing exactly and nothing other than what the tax code tells them they 're supposed to do .

BeReal, a social media app, is encouraging users to be more authentic by banning edited photos. The app allows users to post only unedited photos of themselves and share stories, opinions, and moments that are real, unfiltered and from the heart.

The idea for the app came from its creator, Shannon Harrington, who wanted to create a platform for people to express themselves without relying on the crutch of digitally altering their appearance.

“I have been extremely frustrated with how our society looks at beauty,” Harrington said. “I believe that everyone is beautiful in their own right and editing photos takes away from that beauty. I want BeReal to be a platform where people can be 100 percent themselves and be proud of it.”

BeReal’s mission is to rid the platform of filters and editing apps, which it says make it difficult for people to truly accept themselves for who they are. To make sure that edited photos aren’t posted on the app, the company uses a sophisticated algorithm to detect and flag edited photos.

The algorithm works by detecting certain patterns and facial features that have been edited. It can also detect any additional information, such as lighting or color correction, that’s been applied to the photo. If a photo is flagged as edited, users are given the option to either delete it or keep it, but it won’t be posted to the public until it has been verified as being unedited.

The idea behind the app is to create a safe space where people can be their true selves without the pressure of having to conform to society’s beauty standards. Users can create posts, stories, and galleries of their real selves—all without any filters or editing.

The app also features a community section, where users can connect and share stories and experiences with each other. BeReal is hoping that this will give users the chance to get to know each other on a deeper level, as well as be supportive of each other’s personal journeys.

So far, the app has been met with a positive response and is growing quickly in popularity. While not everyone is on board with the concept, most users seem to agree that it’s a breath of fresh air in a world where photo-editing has become the norm.

BeReal is part of a growing movement of apps, websites, and brands that are encouraging users to be more authentic and embrace their true selves. This wave of self-love and acceptance is slowly but surely beginning to change the way we view and present ourselves online.

Hilton

Era impensable no hablar de los hermanos Hilton este año, pues han sido blanco de innumerables polémicas que no ha dejado de ser el centro de conversación de los estadounidenses. 

La hermandad líder en los EEUU desde hace un par de años, formada por el heredero del imperio hotelero -los Hilton- Rick y su hermano menor Guillermo, han sufrido críticas más o menos fuertes de los medios de comunicación.

Los problemas empezaron cuando Rick fue protagonista de una pelea a puñetazos con el actor Jamie Marsden, uno de sus mejores amigos.

La pelea tuvo lugar a finales del año pasado en la fiesta de cumpleaños de una amiga en común, organizada por Rick mismo. Según testigos, la discusión comenzó a raíz de una discusión acerca de la familia Hilton y de quien debería heredar sus bienes.

La noticia no tardó en hacerse pública, especialmente cuando Jamie, al igual que los demás invitados, decidió contar lo sucedido en las redes sociales. Esta acción provocó la irritación de Rick y su hermano Guillermo quienes, según fuentes cercanas a la familia, contrataron a abogados para presentar una demanda de daños y perjuicios contra el actor.

Pero, esta no ha sido la única polémica que ha salpicado a la familia Hilton durante este año. El pasado mes de julio, Guillermo fue acusado de agredir a su hermano menor, Harry, cuando regresaban de una fiesta.

Según diversas versiones de los testigos de la discusión, Guillermo estaba enfadado por la actitud de su hermano y lo abofeteó sin contemplaciones. Harry acabó llorando en los brazos de su hermano mayor, quien trató de tranquilizarlo.

No fue la única agresión que se le atribuye a Guillermo, pues él también fue acusado de haber agredido a una de sus mejores amigas, Kristen Smith, cuando ésta trató de calmarlo. Guillermo se disculpó en público inmediatamente después de lo sucedido y ofreció a Kristen el pago de sus gastos por los daños causados.

Pero, estas no han sido las únicas noticias relacionadas con los hermanos Hilton este año.

Durante los últimos meses han estado envueltos en diversos problemas relacionados con su educación, incluso los informes de calificaciones de Rick demostraron que a pesar de sus grandes esfuerzos no está logrando los resultados esperados. 

Además, el poco interés mostrado por el más pequeño de la familia para asistir a clases y su dedicación en exceso a la vida nocturna también fue una de las mayores controversias. 

Finalmente, en los últimos días se han hecho eco de los rumores de que Guillermo está saliendo en secreto con la hija de una importante familia de Hollywood.

Después de la avalancha de informaciones relacionadas con los hermanos Hilton, lo único que queda por saber es si esta familia de la alta sociedad llegará al final del año con algún escándalo más a sus espaldas.

It’s no secret that the sooner you start saving and investing, the better off you’ll be when you retire. However, for those in their twenties, investing for retirement can seem intimidating, overwhelming, and not a priority. 

But it’s important to start investing and saving during your twenties – it’s the perfect time to build a retirement savings plan and lay the groundwork for a strong financial future. Here’s why you should start thinking about investing and saving now: 

1. Your Money Will Have More Time to Grow 

By investing early, you’re giving your money more time to grow. This is especially true when it comes to investing in stocks, bonds, and mutual funds, which all have the potential for significant returns if given enough time. 

Compound interest is an essential tool for any retirement savings plan. Interest rates are typically low in the early years of your investment, but the longer you allow your money to grow, the more money you’ll have in the long run. 

2. Start With Low Risk, Low Cost Options 

When investing in your twenties, you don’t need to make a big commitment. Start small with low risk, low cost options like index funds or ETFs. These investment vehicles allow you to own a piece of a much larger portfolio, providing a low risk option with the potential for high returns. 

3. Take Advantage of Tax Benefits 

Investing in your twenties also provides you the opportunity to take advantage of tax benefits. Contributions made to certain retirement accounts, such as IRAs or 401(k)s, are often tax deductible. This means that the money you contribute won’t be subject to income taxes, allowing you to save even more for retirement. 

4. Invest in Yourself 

Investing in your twenties doesn’t have to be limited to stocks, bonds, and other retirement savings plans. It’s also important to think about investing in yourself. This could include furthering your education, starting a business, or even investing in your career development. 

By taking the time to invest in yourself, you’ll be building the skills and knowledge necessary to further your career and increase your earning potential. Investing in yourself will provide a substantial return in the future. 

5. Have More Control Over Your Money 

Investing in your twenties is also a great way to have more control over your money. Investing will give you more freedom to choose where to put your money, as opposed to relying on a financial institution or employer-sponsored retirement plan. This will give you the freedom to make investments that best meet your financial goals. 

These are just a few of the reasons why it’s important to start investing and saving in your twenties. Investing early will give you the chance to start building your retirement savings and take advantage of tax benefits. It’s also the perfect time to invest in yourself to further your career and earning potential. Taking the time to invest and save in your twenties will pay off in the long run.

text: In the United States, the Fair Credit Reporting Act (FCRA) and the Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard (PCI DSS) regulate the collection, use, and storage of credit card information by merchants.Under the FCRA, merchants are generally not allowed to collect credit card information for purposes other than the transaction, unless they have the consumer's written permission or the information is required by law. The FCRA also requires merchants to protect the security and confidentiality of credit card information and to dispose of it properly when it is no longer needed.The PCI DSS is a set of security standards that apply to all merchants that accept credit cards as payment. text: If it 's actually shuffle , it should just be random . However , just because it 's random does n't mean you wo n't get chunks of songs from the same artists / albums . Actually it means the opposite . I wo n't go into the math behind this , but statisticians sometimes do what 's called a runs test to figure out if a set of data is random or not . Take for example a situation where someone claims to have flipped a coin 100 times , and wrote down the results . If he did n't flip the same side twice in a row anywhere in those 100 times , it 's likely he 's lying and just wrote down the numbers systematically , without flipping any coin . It 's just as likely as if he had written down 50 heads in a row , then 50 tails . The same holds true for the shuffle feature on an iPod . Getting the same artist several times in a row every so often is actually evidence that it * is * truly random . Now , one more point , something called confirmation bias . It might seem like you get the same artist a lot more often than you should , but this is because that 's what 's called an event , while when it works properly it 's a non - event , because that 's just normal operation . The human brain is wired to recognize and distinctly remember events , while non - events are n't even noticed , let alone remembered . For this reason , even if the runs only happen a few times a week , you might say it happens " constantly " or " all the time " , even though it obviously does n't .
label: hc3human

Klimaschutz und Nachhaltigkeit werden immer wichtiger und werden zunehmend zu einem zentralen Thema der öffentlichen Debatte. Eine neue Gruppe von Aktivisten, die sich „Klima-Kleber“ nennen, hat sich in den letzten Jahren als eine der treibenden Kräfte hinter dieser Bewegung erwiesen. Ihre direkten und provokativen Aktionen haben das Bewusstsein für den Klimawandel in der Bevölkerung und der Politik geschärft. Aber wie werden die Klima-Kleber eigentlich bezahlt und was geben sie für ihre Arbeit aus?

Um das zu beantworten, haben wir einige der renommiertesten Klima-Kleber im ganzen Land interviewt und wir waren überrascht, wie viel sie verdienen und ausgeben.

Die Aktivisten, die sich als Klima-Kleber bezeichnen, sehen sich als diejenigen, die für eine sofortige und ambitionierte globale Klimapolitik eintreten. Sie glauben an direkte Aktionen, um die Öffentlichkeit für das Thema zu sensibilisieren und sind bereit, Risiken einzugehen, um die Aufmerksamkeit auf Klimawandel und Klimaschutz zu lenken.

Unseren Interviews zufolge bekommen Klima-Kleber pro Aktion durchschnittlich zwischen 500 und 1000 Euro. Einige bekommen mehr, während andere weniger bezahlt werden. Die Unternehmen, die sie anheuern, zahlen ihnen normalerweise einmal pro Aktion oder einen pauschalen Betrag, abhängig von ihrer Arbeit.

Trotz des Geldes, das sie bekommen, sind die Klima-Kleber immer noch sehr engagiert und verpflichtet, sich für einen Klimaschutz einzusetzen. Sie sind sich bewusst, dass das, was sie tun, mehr als nur Geld bedeutet. Es ist eine vollständig altruistische Bewegung, die auf die Schaffung eines umfassenden Klimaschutzes ausgerichtet ist.

Auch wenn Klima-Kleber nicht viel Geld bekommen, geben sie das, was sie verdienen, sehr sorgfältig aus. Einige von ihnen setzen ihr Gehalt für lokale Umweltprojekte oder für zusätzliche Ausrüstung wie Aufkleber, Banner und Schilder ein. Andere investieren es in Reisen, um auf Veranstaltungen und Konferenzen zu sprechen oder um neue Kampagnen zu entwickeln.

Darüber hinaus unterstützen viele Klima-Kleber kleinere Unternehmen, die auf nachhaltige Weise Waren produzieren, und beteiligen sich an Spendenaktionen für Umwelt- und Nachhaltigkeitsorganisationen. Auf diese Weise sorgen sie dafür, dass ihre Gelder und Ressourcen in einem breiteren Rahmen genutzt werden, um wirksam Klimaschutzmaßnahmen umzusetzen.

Italy’s ‘harmonious walnut tribe’ - a group of small-scale farmers and land-owners who have lived sustainably for centuries - may no longer have to worry about their energy supply.

The project, funded by Italian energy company Enel and Italian research institute Istituto Enel, provides communities such as the harmonious walnut tribe with solar panels to generate electricity from the sun. The project also includes wind turbines, geothermal and hydroelectric generators, and other sustainable sources of energy.

The project is part of Enel’s commitment to create a sustainable energy future for Italy and to support communities in remote and rural areas.

The harmonious walnut tribe is located in the province of Abruzzo in the Appenine Mountains, and has lived off the land sustainably for centuries. The village is largely self-sufficient and relies on the abundance of local resources.

The locals have harvested walnuts, vegetables, and fruits from the land, while bee-keeping, sheep and goat herding, forestry, and wine-making form the basis of the community’s livelihoods.

In the past, the village has relied on generators to power their homes and produce electricity, but these are expensive to operate and use fuel that is often hard to come by. This means that villagers have had to rely on unreliable electricity supplies, particularly in the winter months.

The solar panel installation will be a welcome relief for the community. As Enel states, “With the installation of the solar panels, the harmonious walnut tribe can now access clean and renewable energy at zero cost. The villagers will no longer have to worry about unreliable electricity supplies, and they can use the energy generated by the solar panels to power their homes and produce electricity for the village.”

The project is part of Enel’s larger plan to create a sustainable energy future for Italy. The company has already installed solar panels and wind turbines in several Italian regions, and the goal is to eventually provide affordable, clean energy to millions of people.

The project is also a testament to the resilience of the harmonious walnut tribe, who have managed to maintain their lifestyle and culture despite living in one of the most isolated areas of Italy.

The project is also a reminder of the power of small-scale farming and land-owners, who have a great potential to build a greener, more sustainable future if given the right support.

As the chief of the harmonious walnut tribe, Carlo Gnerre, states, “This project is an example of how with a small intervention we can make a big difference. The representatives said that new legislation would need to be introduced in the coming months to address these issues. “The days of these companies being able to take advantage of their massive reach without any consequences are over,” said Representative Jim Langevin, D-R.I. “It is time for Congress to act, and I look forward to introducing legislation soon.”

This is not the first time that Congress has proposed new regulations for social media companies. In 2021, several members introduced a bill that would have created a new federal agency to oversee the companies and ensure they were taking necessary steps to protect their users. The bill never made it out of the House.

text:
(CNN) – Desde principios de diciembre, Southwest Airlines ha cancelado un número récord de vuelos en Estados Unidos a medida que la demanda cae debido a la recesión económica causada por la pandemia de Covid-19.

La empresa de transporte aéreo ha sido el único portador estadounidense a cancelar más vuelos que programar en los últimos tres meses, la señal más clara de lo difícil que es hoy volar en los Estados Unidos.

El domingo, Southwest informó que estaba cancelando miles de vuelos para el periodo de Navidad de diciembre a enero, incluyendo algunos vuelos entre el 27 de diciembre y el 5 de enero. En particular, el 27 de diciembre habrá 1,419 vuelos cancelados, seguido del 1 de enero con 1,155 vuelos cancelados.

"Sabemos que los recientes cambios pueden ser incómodos, por lo que le agradecemos su paciencia mientras ajustamos nuestra programación", dijo el CEO de Southwest Airlines, Gary Kelly. "Las restricciones de viaje varían y están cambiando constantemente, así que nos mantendremos en sintonía con estas variaciones para cumplir con los requisitos federales".

En un comunicado emitido en la misma fecha, Southwest también anunció que los precios de los boletos disminuirían en los próximos meses, ya que la demanda se ha visto afectada por la disminución de la actividad de viajes.

La pandemia ha impactado negativamente el sector de la aviación comercial en los Estados Unidos, con cientos de vuelos cancelados y los principales aeropuertos con menos del 20 por ciento de pasajeros.

Southwest Airlines es una de las compañías estadounidenses más grandes en la industria de la aviación. La empresa ha estado operando desde 1967 y ofrece más de 4.000 vuelos diarios a destinos en Estados Unidos, México y las islas del Caribe.

Desde la declaración de emergencia nacional del coronavirus de parte del presidente de los Estados Unidos, Donald Trump, en marzo de 2020, Southwest Airlines ha perdido varios miles de millones de dólares. Desde entonces, la aerolínea ha cancelado cerca de 200.000 vuelos programados para el año.

Para intentar reducir los costos, la compañía ha recortado cerca de 20.000 puestos de trabajo y cancelado algunas de sus rutas. También ha suspendido el pago de dividendos a sus accionistas.

También en el año, Southwest Airlines ofreció miles de asientos de bajo costo para empleados afectados por el cierre de empresas durante la pandemia. La aerolínea también brindó asistencia con el alojamiento en hoteles para su personal.

Desde la irrupción de la pandemia, la industria de la aviación ha estado luchando por adaptarse a las nuevas realidades. Las aerolíneas han estado trabajando en concierto con el gobierno de los Estados Unidos para fortalecer los protocolos de seguridad e implementar nuevas normas de distanciamiento social.

Aun así, no hay señales claras de que la situación mejorará en el corto plazo. El coronavirus sigue propagándose a lo largo y ancho del país, y muchas ciudades están aplicando nuevas restricciones de viaje y limitaciones para disminuir el riesgo de contener el virus

European stocks ended the week on a positive note, with the region's benchmark index closing higher on Friday as investors assess the likelihood of further interest rate rises.

The Stoxx Europe 600 rose 0.72 percent by the close of business, with all but one of its regional peers finishing in positive territory.

Germany's DAX also posted strong gains, closing up 1.59 percent. Automakers Daimler and Volkswagen were the biggest contributors to the index's gains, up 4.7 percent and 4.8 percent respectively.

France's CAC 40 also rose, closing up 0.72 percent. Shares of supermarket retailer Carrefour climbed 4.5 percent and oil major Total rose 0.9 percent.

The pan-European benchmark has been rising since the start of this week, boosted by speculation that the European Central Bank could raise interest rates as soon as its next meeting in March.

The ECB has been cautious about the outlook for monetary policy, with President Mario Draghi saying earlier this week that the bank will continue to monitor the economic data before making a decision on rates.

The euro edged higher against the dollar on Friday, as investors bet that the central bank could raise rates as soon as March. The single currency was up 0.3 percent at $1.207 by the close of business.

The rise in European stocks was also driven by a bounce back in oil prices. Brent crude, the international benchmark, rose 0.6 percent to settle at $55.55 per barrel.

Elsewhere in European markets, Italy's FTSE MIB rose 0.63 percent, Spain's IBEX 35 advanced 0.9 percent and Greece's Athex Composite ended the day up 1.6 percent.

In commodities, gold was down 0.1 percent to trade at $1,256.61 an ounce. Copper was down 0.6 percent at $6,246.00 a tonne.

On the data front, Eurozone inflation slowed in November, according to figures released by Eurostat on Friday. Consumer prices rose by an annual rate of 1.9 percent, down from October's 2.0 percent rise.

The weak inflation data adds to the case for the ECB to maintain its dovish policy. With inflation still below the bank's target of 2.0 percent, the central bank is likely to continue its ultra-loose monetary policy for the foreseeable future.

Looking ahead to next week, investors will be eyeing Tuesday's meeting of the Bank of England for clues on the direction of monetary policy in the U.K. On Wednesday, the European Central Bank is expected to release its latest monetary policy decision and accompanying statement.

text: Hey , Ph . D here working on light induced degradation ( LID ) in solar cells . Essentially , you need to think of the efficiency of a solar cell as its ability to generate but also collect electrons as useful energy . Now in the body of the solar cell , which we call the bulk , you can get many things that will steal that electron and stop it from being collected . These include metallic impurities ( Iron , chromium , copper ... etc . ) , crystallographic defects and usually anything that has a charge that can capture an electron or a hole ( which we call charge carriers ) . The more of these defects you have the lower your effective efficiency . So what happens out in the field over time ? There are many things that can happen that can cause a module to degrade . On the macro level , standard deterioration from corrosion , UV exposure , humidity , etc as mentioned by others in this thread . We also have a few such as PID ( potential induced degradation ) and LID ( Light Induced Degradation ) . LID for example in monocrystalline solar cells is largely known to be due to the Boron - Oxygen defects . Under sunlight , boron and oxygen can combine together to form a B - O complex , which likes to steal charge carriers and usually results in a drop in efficiency within the first 48 hours . Now this problem has largely been solved . There are a few other known elements that can cause degradation under sunlight , i.e copper ( which can form precipitates ) and Hydrogen , etc etc ..

text: A generalized linear model (GLM) is a flexible statistical model that can be used to analyze a wide range of data types. It is an extension of the linear regression model, which is used to model the relationship between a continuous response variable and one or more predictor variables.    The key difference between a linear regression model and a GLM is that in a GLM, the response variable is not necessarily continuous and may follow a different distribution, such as a binomial, poisson, or gamma distribution. The GLM allows for the modeling of this type of data by using a link function to relate the mean of the response variable to a linear combination of the predictor variables.    In a GLM, the response variable is assumed to follow a certain distribution, and the mean of this distribution is modeled as a linear combination of the predictor variables. The parameters of the model are estimated by maximizing the likelihood of the data, which is the probability of observing the data given the model.    Examples of GLMs include logistic regression for modeling binary data, Poisson regression for modeling count data, and gamma regression for modeling continuous data with a positive skew.

HONG KONG (Reuters) - "The shrill sound of democracy may well be heard in Hong Kong, with hundreds of tiny hamsters taking up residence in some of the city's most iconic sites.

The furry new residents are a familiar sight in urban parks, bustling business districts and residential buildings, but now the hamsters have become a symbol of the city's struggle for democratic reform.

The move is part of an effort by activists to draw attention to the territory's political status and the lack of free speech.

"The hamsters are a reminder of Hong Kong's political reality," said Hong Kong-based activist Chow Kin-man. "People should not forget that the city is ruled by the Chinese Communist Party, not by the people of Hong Kong."

The hamsters, mostly of the species domestica, have become the latest symbol of democratic dissent in the city, with activists using them as a way to draw attention to the lack of political reform.

The hamsters were first spotted in 2018, when thousands of people took to the streets to protest against a proposed extradition bill. The protests eventually turned into a broader movement, pushing for greater autonomy and democratic reforms.

Though the extradition bill has since been dropped, the activists are now focused on pushing the government to introduce universal suffrage in the city, and are using the hamsters to draw attention to the cause.

The hamsters have become a common sight in the city, with activists setting up homes for them in busy public spaces. Some of the hamsters have even been trained to perform basic commands, such as circling around a sign in a protest march, or holding banners to display slogans.

Activists have also been using the animals to highlight the issues of inequality and injustice. In a city where a handful of wealthy tycoons hold much of the political power, the hamsters are a reminder of the struggles ordinary citizens face.

"The hamsters are a powerful symbol of the struggle for democracy in Hong Kong," said Chow. "It's a reminder that even the smallest creatures have the power to bring about positive change."

The hamsters have become a fixture in the city, with some activists even saying that their numbers have grown so much that they can be found in almost every corner of the city.

Though the hamsters have been warmly welcomed by the citizens of Hong Kong, the Chinese government has expressed concern about their activities.

In 2019, the Chinese government issued a warning to the activists to keep their furry friends under control, and said that they would be held responsible if any of the hamsters caused disruption or chaos.

It is unclear whether the warning has been heeded, but the hamsters continue to be a symbol of the struggle for democracy in Hong Kong.

Though their cause may seem insignificant to some, the hamsters continue to fight for justice and freedom, and they remain a reminder that even the smallest creatures can create change.

text:
2023 is Our Time to Save Earth with a Green Economy

With climate change becoming an ever-increasing threat, the global community is under immense pressure to reverse the damage already done and come up with lasting solutions. After three decades of largely failed attempts to limit global warming, it is becoming increasingly clear that we need a new approach to solving the climate crisis. The year 2023 may be the year that humanity finally takes decisive action to mitigate the effects of climate change, and puts a focus on green economic growth to save our planet.

The past 30 years have seen various attempts to tackle the issue of climate change, with the Paris Climate Agreement of 2015 being the most successful effort. Despite this, global average temperature continues to rise, sea levels have risen dramatically, extreme weather events are becoming more frequent, and the number of species that are endangered is growing exponentially. The effects of climate change are now a reality, and the only way we can stop them from escalating is to put a much greater emphasis on green economic growth.

Green economic growth is based on the idea of using resources more responsibly, so as to make them more sustainable in the long run. It involves investing in renewable energy sources, such as solar and wind, and switching away from fossil fuels, which contribute the most to global warming. Furthermore, it involves encouraging more efficient use of resources, such as reducing the use of plastics, developing more efficient methods of transportation, and investing in green technology. Green economic growth is not just good for the environment, but also for the economy, as it creates new jobs and investment opportunities.

There have already been a number of positive initiatives taken to promote green economic growth across the world, such as the European Green Deal, which aims to make the European Union carbon neutral by 2050. Other countries have also joined the fight, with China and India both pledging to cut their emissions drastically over the next decade.

2023 will be the year when we must take decisive action to bring about green economic growth. Governments must invest in renewable energy sources, encourage more efficient resource use, and put a focus on green technology. Businesses must also play their part, investing in green technology and developing more sustainable practices.

The transition to a green economy may not be easy, but it is a necessary one. If we fail to act now, the consequences for the planet and for humanity will be catastrophic. The time for action is now, and 2023 is the year that we must take a stand to save our planet. It is up to us, as individuals, as governments, and as businesses, to ensure that we make the changes necessary to ensure a prosperous future for the generations that come after us. It is time to put our differences aside and work together to save the planet.

Aaron Rodgers threw four touchdown passes, Aaron Jones and Jamaal Williams combined for nearly 200 rushing yards, and the Packers defense made Minnesota quarterback Kirk Cousins look ordinary in a 24-17 blowout win over the Vikings.

The win puts the Packers (11-3) one step closer to securing a spot in the playoffs and, if the team can continue to show the kind of dominance they displayed on Sunday night, they could be in position to make a deep run in January.

Rodgers was the star of the show against Minnesota, completing 22 of 28 passes for 230 yards, four touchdowns and no interceptions. He did all of that without his top two wide receivers, Davante Adams and Allen Lazard, who were both inactive due to injury.

His favorite target was tight end Robert Tonyan, who had a career-high six receptions for 98 yards and two touchdowns. Tonyan, who had been quiet for most of the season, is emerging as one of the top tight ends in the league, and his performance on Sunday night should help him earn the respect he deserves.

The Packers running game was just as impressive as Rodgers’ performance. Jones, who returned from an injury last week, carried the ball 15 times for 70 yards, while Williams picked up 79 yards and a touchdown on 15 attempts. Together, the duo kept the Vikings defense on their heels all night long.

The Packers’ defense also deserves some credit for their performance against the Vikings. After struggling over the past few weeks, they made Cousins and the Vikings offense look ordinary. Cousins was held to just 172 passing yards and one touchdown, while the Packers defense forced three turnovers – one fumble and two interceptions.

The win over the Vikings was huge for the Packers, and it should help them secure a spot in the playoffs. However, they’re far from a lock at this point, as they still have two tough games remaining on their schedule. They’ll need to keep up their winning ways to ensure that they can make a run in the postseason.

For now, however, the Packers can enjoy the fact that they’re one win away from securing a playoff berth. They did it in style on Sunday night, with a blowout win over the Vikings. If they can keep up their current level of play, they’ll be a tough out for anyone in the playoffs.

text: Personally, I think you are approaching this from the wrong angle.  You're somewhat correct in assuming that what you're reading is usually some kind of marketing material.  Systematic Investment Plan (SIP) is not a universal piece of jargon in the financial world.  Dollar cost averaging is a pretty universal piece of jargon in the financial world and is a common topic taught in finance classes in the US. On average, verified by many studies, individuals will generate better investment returns when they proactively avoid timing the market or attempting to pick specific winners.  Say you decide to invest in a mutual fund, dollar cost averaging means you invest the same dollar amount in consistent intervals rather than buying a number of shares or buying sporadically when you feel the market is low. As an example I'll compare investing $50 per week on Wednesdays, versus 1 share per week on Wednesdays, or the full $850 on the first Wednesday.   I'll use the Vanguard Large cap fund as an example (VLCAX).  I realize this is not really an apples to apples comparison as the invested amounts are different, I just wanted to show how your rate of return can change depending on how your money goes in to the market even if the difference is subtle.  By investing a common dollar amount rather than a common share amount you ultimately maintain a lower average share price while the share price climbs.  It also keeps your investment easy to budget. Vanguard published an excellent paper discussing dollar cost averaging versus lump sum investing which concluded that you should invest as soon as you have funds, rather than parsing out a lump sum in to smaller periodic investments, which is illustrated in the third column above; and obviously worked out well as the market has been increasing. Ultimately, all of these companies are vying to customers so they all have marketing teams trying to figure out how to make their services sound interesting and unique.  If they all called dollar cost averaging, "dollar cost averaging" none of them would appear to be unique.  So they devise neat acronyms but it's all pretty much the same idea.  Trickle your money in to your investments as the money becomes available to you.
label: hc3human

text:
There are three serious heart conditions that are often confused, but have important differences. Cardiac arrest, heart attack, and heart failure all have the same basic cause--diseases of the heart muscle--but the way each condition affects the body and the treatments available are quite different.

Cardiac arrest is a sudden loss of heart function. It happens when electrical signals in the heart's electrical system become chaotic and the heart stops pumping blood to the body and brain. In cardiac arrest, the heart stops abruptly and without warning, often without any pain or warning. Cardiac arrest is an emergency medical situation that requires immediate medical attention.

Heart attack, or myocardial infarction, is when a section of the heart muscle stops receiving enough blood and oxygen. This usually occurs due to a blockage in the coronary artery, which carries blood to the heart. A heart attack can cause chest pain or discomfort and can even cause death if not treated in time.

Heart failure is when the heart is not able to pump enough blood and oxygen to the body. Heart failure can be caused by a range of conditions, such as coronary artery disease, high blood pressure, obesity, and diabetes. Symptoms of heart failure include shortness of breath, fatigue, and swelling in the legs, ankles, and feet.

All three conditions can be life-threatening and require immediate medical attention. But the treatment for each of these conditions will depend on the type and severity of the condition. Treatment for cardiac arrest is often an electrical shock called defibrillation to help restore normal rhythm. Heart attack treatment may involve clot-dissolving medications, surgery, or other treatments to restore blood flow to the heart. Heart failure treatment often involves lifestyle changes, such as diet and exercise, as well as medications and surgery.

When it comes to managing any of these heart conditions, it is important to understand the differences between them and to pay attention to your symptoms. If you experience any of the signs or symptoms of these conditions, seek medical attention immediately. Knowing the differences between these heart conditions can help you recognize the signs and symptoms and get the help you need.

text: Fiber optics is a technology that uses thin strands of glass or plastic called optical fibers to transmit information, such as data or voice, over long distances. These fibers are extremely thin, about the diameter of a human hair, and are made of a special type of glass or plastic that is very good at transmitting light.  Light travels through the fiber optic cables by bouncing off the walls of the fibers. This happens because the walls of the fibers are very smooth and the light reflects off them in a way that keeps it moving forward. The light reflects off the walls so many times that it travels a very long distance without losing much energy or intensity.  One reason that light can enter the fiber optic cable but not exit is because the walls of the fiber are made of a material that is very good at reflecting light. This means that when the light hits the walls, it bounces off them and continues traveling through the fiber. However, the walls of the fiber are also very smooth, which makes it difficult for the light to escape. This is why the light stays inside the fiber and is able to travel such a long distance without losing much intensity.  There are many practical applications of fiber optic technology. For example, it is often used to transmit data over long distances, such as in the internet. It is also used in telecommunications, cable television, and medical equipment. In these and other applications, fiber optics allows for fast, reliable, and secure communication.

On Tuesday, the SEC quietly ended its investigation into the pair without taking any action against either man, according to lawyers familiar with the matter.

The investigation was launched in January of 2019 after news broke that Burr and his brother-in-law had each sold hundreds of thousands of dollars worth of stock just weeks before the stock market took a nosedive due to the COVID-19 pandemic. The move raised suspicions that they had benefited from confidential information they had access to as public officials, although neither has been charged with any wrongdoing.

The SEC's investigation was complicated and lengthy, with the commission gathering and reviewing a significant amount of information. The probe included interviews with both Burr and Fulmer and extended to other individuals, including other politicians, business executives, and the fund’s investors.

The lawyers familiar with the investigation said that the SEC determined that Burr and Fulmer had not violated any laws or regulations, and that the sales of the stock were not in any way related to the pandemic. The lawyers said the SEC's decision was based on the fact that the trades were “overwhelmingly offsetting” and there was no evidence that either man had “obtained any nonpublic information” or “made a material misstatement or omission” when making the trades.

The SEC declined to comment on the investigation, while Burr and Fulmer did not immediately respond to a request for comment.
