Gold prices tumbled more than 1% on Tuesday after U.S. economic data lifted the dollar and raised hopes for a prolonged period of Federal Reserve rate hikes.

Spot gold dropped 1.2% to $1,841.08 per ounce by 16:14 GMT, its lowest level since late November. U.S. gold futures declined 1.3% to $1,846.

Strong U.S. economic data on Tuesday increased the prospects of a prolonged period of Fed rate hikes and lifted the greenback. The U.S. dollar index rose 0.4% and is on track for its third straight day of gains.

The report on U.S. housing starts came in significantly stronger than expected, up 2.8% compared to expectations of a 0.3% decline. In addition, the report showed that permits had also risen 1.3%, exceeding expectations of a 0.5% decline.

A further increase in U.S. Treasury yields increased demand for the greenback, putting pressure on gold. The 10-year U.S. Treasury yield rose to 1.63%, its highest since March 2020.

The gains in the dollar offset investors’ concerns over the new more transmissible variant of the coronavirus that has been detected in the U.K., as well as a continued rise in infections in the U.S.

“The recent string of U.S. economic data has certainly been positive,” said Bart Melek, Head of Commodity Strategies at TD Securities. “But, it’s been a little too strong for the market’s liking, with gold prices heading lower on Tuesday as a result.”

The U.S. economy continues to show strong signs of recovery and is expected to continue to grow in 2021 as the rollout of a vaccine and fiscal stimulus should continue to bolster demand.

The Fed has pledged to keep rates at or near current levels through 2022 to support the economic recovery. However, traders are now speculating that the central bank could signal a rate hike sooner than expected.

Gold investors are also keeping a close eye on the progress of the U.S. stimulus package. Negotiations between the White House and Democrats over the relief package have been ongoing for weeks and have yet to reach an agreement.

“It’s quite possible that gold will get another boost when stimulus finally passes,” said Melek. “But, in the short term, the strong data and a potential rate hike being priced in by the markets will likely keep gold under pressure.”

The precious metal is seen as a safe-haven asset, and usually gains when economic uncertainty rises. Gold has seen strong gains since the start of the pandemic as the Fed slashed interest rates to near zero, making gold a more attractive asset for investors.

text: The important thing to know is how insects breathe . Insects do n't breathe through their mouths like us ; they do n't even have lungs . They have tiny holes in their exoskeleton which allows oxygen into system of tubes , which carry oxygen to their organs . With that in mind , let 's think about what happens when something increases in size . Two things increase : volume , and surface area . The dependence between the two is not linear , though . In other words , volume and surface area increase by different rates . Think of a 1x1x1 foot cube . It has a volume of 1 , and a surface area of 6 . Now , a 2x2x2 cube . It has a volume of 8 , and a surface area of 24 ( six sides , 4 sq ft per side ) . The volume increased by * eight times * , but the surface area only increased by * four * . 3x3x3 ? Volume of 27 , surface area of 54 . The volume more than tripled , whereas the surface area roughly doubled . Now , the point here is that * volume * is what matters for the weight of an animal . That means that there 's more organs and whatnot , all of which need oxygen . The amount of oxygen available , though , depends on * surface area * . Insects get oxygen from their skin , so to increase their oxygen intake , they need to increase the surface area of their skin . You ca n't add more holes in the exoskeleton to increase the oxygen flow to compensate , because that makes the exoskeleton weaker . The exoskeleton is * already * under extra strain trying to support the increased weight , so that wo n't work . This means that there 's essentially a point where an insect ca n't grow any bigger , because it does n't have enough surface area ( oxygen supply ) to make up for the increased volume / weight ( need for oxygen ) . For more evidence of this being why insects ca n't increase in size , they used to be much bigger millions and millions of years ago during dinosaur times . The atmosphere was richer in oxygen back then , so it makes sense .

text: The balance sheet is a deceptively easy item in accounting . What it tells you is three things : 1 ) How big of a pile of stuff do I own ? 2 ) How much money did I borrow to buy my big pile of stuff that I still have to pay back ? 3 ) If I removed everything from my pile of stuff that I still owe money on , how much is left ? This smaller pile of stuff that you have paid in full for and that you do n't owe another cent on is your " equity " . It can be broken down to the classic accounting equation of : ASSETS ( Total Pile of Stuff ) = Liabilities ( Stuff in your pile that the bank can take back because you have n't paid for it yet ) + Equity ( Stuff in the pile that is paid for and yours forever ) Or , in terms of a home , if I take out a mortgage and buy a $ 200,000 house , and promptly pay $ 100,000 as a down payment , I own half of a house . That is my equity . The bank owns the other $ 100,000 of the house , and that is my liability . Again , the equation tells us : Total Assets ( The Whole House , 200k ) = Liabilities ( Bank 's half of the house 100k ) + Equity ( my half of the house that I plunked down 100k for ) . To answer the question about what equity is in finance , this is how is it important : Let us say that I owned an entrepreneurial cat . The cat decides to get into the business of rat control . I take the cat to the bank , and the bank lends the cat $ 995,000 as a business loan under the agreement that the bank can repossesses everything if the loan is n't paid back with interest . The cat takes the bank 's 995k and I throw in 5k of my own money that the cat never has to pay me back for , and he buys 1 million dollars worth of rat control equipment . Now if I went on Craigslist and offered to sell the cat and his 1 million dollars worth of rat control supplies to the highest bidder , my cat might sell for close to 1 million dollars . However , once the potential buyer found out that the 1 million dollar cat owes $ 995,000 to the bank still , the potential buyer would realize the EQUITY in the cat is only $ 5,000 , and would n't pay much more than that . Now that begs the question , why would I give the feline $ 5,000 that he did n't have to pay me back for ? This relates to the second use of the phrase equity in finance , which is ownership . I gave the cat $ 5,000 to become a partner in his business . Think of this as " seed money " that the cat can spend on things that will make his business better , and that he does n't have to worry about paying me interest on or ever repaying directly . Instead , he gives me 100 shares of Rat Cat Stock of a total 200 shares outstanding . He owns the other 100 , which he assigned to himself when incorporating his business . What 's in it for me ? As owner of 50 % of the EQUITY in the company ( I own 100 of 200 total shares ) , I am entitled to half of the profits ! Now if the cat is very successful and makes $ 200,000 in profits each year after paying interest on his loan to the bank , that is great for me ! Going back to our general accounting equation : Assets $ 1.2 Million Dollars ( 1 Million Dollars in Supplies + $ 200,000 profit ) = Liabilities ( 1 Million Principle Still Owed to the Bank ) + 200k ( Equity , money that belongs outright to me and the cat ! ) . The amount of money we borrowed from the bank does n't change . We still have 1 million dollars worth of equipment that could be liquidated and sold to pay back the bank , so that 200k is pure profit for us ( me and my cat ) as business owners . Now this $ 200,000 can either be paid to use in the form of dividends , or reinvested in new equipment and services that can help the business grow .

The term "dialectic" refers to a way of thinking about ideas and problems that involves examining different points of view and looking for a synthesis or resolution. In the context of Marxist theory, dialectics refers to the idea that social and historical change occurs through the conflict and resolution of opposing ideas or forces.

For example, Marx believed that the conflict between different classes in society, such as the bourgeoisie (owners of the means of production) and the proletariat (workers), was a key driver of social and economic change. He believed that this conflict could eventually lead to a resolution, such as the overthrow of the capitalist system and the establishment of a socialist society.

So, when something is described as being "dialectically related," it means that it is connected to or influenced by this process of conflict and resolution. It might be helpful to think of dialectics as a kind of "back and forth" between different ideas or forces, with the ultimate goal of finding a solution or resolution.

Global coal use is on course to hit an all-time high this year, the International Energy Agency said in a report Thursday.

The IEA’s report, Coal 2020, indicates that demand for coal in 2020 is on track to reach a record level of 8.4 billion tonnes of oil equivalent (Gtoe), up around 3.4% from 2019. This would mark a continuation of the rising coal demand seen in recent years, which saw global coal use increase in each of the previous three years.

The report attributed the increase to the continuing expansion of coal-fired power plants in some of the world’s most populous countries, as well as a rebound in demand from industrial users. The demand growth was especially notable in Asia, where new capacity in countries such as India and Vietnam drove the sector’s resurgence.

In its report, the IEA said the world’s top three coal-consuming countries—China, India, and the United States—were likely to combine for over two-thirds of global coal demand in 2020. However, it warned that the countries’ reliance on the fossil fuel could cause a longer-term energy transition problem if current trends continued unchecked.

“Unless policies to accelerate a shift away from coal are implemented quickly, our latest outlook shows that global coal-fired power capacity and related CO2 emissions will keep increasing to 2040,” said Dr. Fatih Birol, the IEA’s executive director.

The IEA’s warning comes as concerns over the environment and climate change continue to mount. In recent years, governments around the world have sought to reduce emissions from coal-fired power plants, but progress has been slow.

The IEA said governments should take stronger action to accelerate the coal transition, including encouraging investments in renewable energy and phasing out coal subsidies. The agency also noted that coal could still play a role in the energy transition, if the sector were to develop low-carbon technologies such as carbon capture and storage.

The IEA’s report comes amid increasing calls from environmental activists for governments to take more decisive action to phase out coal. Last month, the United Nations Environmental Programme warned that the world needed to make “transformative” changes to its energy systems in order to meet its climate goals.

At the same time, however, the IEA said that it was important to note that coal still played a significant role in the global energy mix, accounting for around 27% of global primary energy demand. This was down slightly from the 2019 level of 29%, but still a significant share, the agency said.

“While a significant share of the global energy system is still dependent on coal, our latest analysis shows that the tide is turning,” said Dr. Birol. “More and more countries are setting clear commitments to accelerate the transition away from coal and, despite the remarkable rebound this year, global coal demand is set to remain below its previous peak and to keep declining over the next two decades.”

Het nieuwe vermogensbelastingjaar is in 2023 officieel van start gegaan en er zijn verschillende veranderingen die van invloed zijn op hoeveel belasting je betaalt. In dit artikel bespreken we wat de nieuwe vermogensbelastingmethode is en wat dat betekent voor uw portemonnee.

In de nieuwe vermogensbelasting zijn er twee belastingtarieven. Er is een lage tarief van 15%, die wordt toegepast op uw bruto-vermogen tot €500.000, en er is een hoge tarief van 35%, die wordt toegepast op uw bruto-vermogen boven €500.000. De tarieven zijn van toepassing op alle belastingplichtigen, zowel voor particulieren als ondernemingen.

Bovendien is er een vrijstelling van €10.000 voor de eerste €100.000 van uw vermogen. Als uw vermogen hoger is dan €100.000, dan wordt de €10.000 vrijstelling toegepast op alle extra vermogen dat u heeft.

Voor een enkelpersoonshuishouden betekent dit dat als je vermogen meer is dan €100.000, je 15% vermogensbelasting betaalt over het bruto-vermogen tot €500.000 en 35% over het bruto-vermogen dat boven €500.000 ligt.

Het is belangrijk op te merken dat alleen het "netto" vermogen wordt belast. Wat dat precies betekent is dat u uw vermogen moet berekenen zonder schulden. Als u bijvoorbeeld €500.000 in beleggingen heeft, maar u heeft ook €500.000 aan hypotheekschulden, dan wordt er geen vermogensbelasting geheven over uw vermogen.

Om het voor belastingbetalers gemakkelijker te maken om de vermogensbelasting te berekenen, heeft de Nederlandse belastingdienst een rekentool gelanceerd. Hiermee kunnen zij hun bruto-vermogen invoeren en de belastingdienst rekent uit hoeveel vermogensbelasting ze moeten betalen.

Hoewel er een vrijstelling is voor de eerste €100.000 van uw vermogen, betekent dit niet dat iedereen van de vermogensbelasting vrijgesteld is. Er zijn namelijk nog steeds een aantal situaties waarin de vermogensbelasting geheven kan worden, zoals bij het bezit van vastgoed, kapitaalverzekeringen en beleggingsfondsen.

Ook is het belangrijk op te merken dat de vermogensbelasting niet alleen geldt voor personen die in Nederland belastingplichtig zijn. Voor buitenlandse belastingplichtigen gelden dezelfde regels. Als zij meer dan €100.000 bezitten, dan moeten zij ook de vermogensbelasting betalen.

Tot slot is het belangrijk om te weten dat de vermogensbelasting een jaarlijks terugkerend belastingvoordeel is. Als u de vermogensbelasting in het eerste kwartaal van het jaar betaalt, dan krijgt u een teruggave als uw vermogen over het hele jaar niet meer is dan €100.000.

De vermogensbelasting heeft een hoop nieuwe regels en tarieven, dus het is belangrijk dat u de tijd neemt om te begrijpen hoe de nieuwe methode precies werkt. Als u meer informatie nodig heeft, dan kunt u contact opnemen met de belastingdienst

text: Not in a fraternity , but a foreigner who spent time studying at a US college . Fraternities ( and sororities ) are basically structured social groups . When college students leave their hometown and arrive at college , they often know very few people and are not used to taking the initiative in meeting people . Fraternities provide a medium for students to socialise and bond . Since fraternities often have a reputation , students can join to meet likeminded peers who they might not otherwise meet . For example , some fraternities will have a charity focus , others will have people who grew up in a certain area , others will attract goofy guys or sporty guys . Fraternities also provide structured social situations to meet girls ( or sororities for meeting boys ) by holding parties , date nights and other functions . Finally , because the drinking age in America is 21 , most students ca n't go to bars for the first few years of college , so fraternities also function as social hubs in the same way that bars / clubs do once you reach the legal drinking age . Having said that , there are arguably a number of downsides to fraternities . They can perpetuate social stratification because current members of the fraternity pick the incoming members . Members will often only want to invite freshman students who are similar to them , and so the fraternity and sorority scene can appear quite insular . I have heard that people belong in a certain fraternity because they went to X high school , they have family money , or because they are a ' legacy ' ( i.e. their dad / mum was in the fraternity / sorority ) . Also , because only fraternities hold parties ( sororities have nice houses and do n't want them trashed ) , guys in the ' cool ' fraternities hold an imbalance of social power as other students ( particularly girls ) need to befriend them to get invited to the parties ( if they ca n't get into bars ) . Obviously not all of them are like that ( in fact , most frat brothers I met were great blokes ) but it was something I noticed .

text: Aubrey de Grey has catalogued [ seven types of aging damage ] ( URL_0 ) . To summarize : * Cells age and stop functioning but do n't get replaced fast enough . * Cells grab onto each other by forming protein links . They do this slowly over time . Eventually , it makes your tissues rigid when they should be supple . * Garbage can accumulate inside and outside cells . * DNA mutations . This can cause cancer and a few other problems . These are kind of " ultimate causes " and pretty general . But we can follow them into more direct causes . For instance , your tissues are getting rigid . Specifically , your arteries . Normally , arteries shrink and expand according to how much blood you have in you . This is good and healthy . If your arteries ca n't react , you end up with high blood pressure ( if they 're stuck in a constricted position ) or low blood pressure ( if they 're stuck in an open position -- I 'm not sure if this is possible ) . This leads to further problems -- high blood pressure leaves you liable to aneurysms , heart attacks , and strokes . Or , your cells are dying and not getting replaced . One cell generally is n't important , but if it happens to a lot of cells in your pancreas , you might lose the ability to make essential hormones . Or if it happens to your kidneys , you might build up toxic chemicals in your blood that your kidneys normally filter out . Or garbage outside your cells -- that garbage can be in your blood vessels . If it accumulates in one spot , it puts you at risk of an embolism , as /u / corbincox72 mentions .

There are many different reasons why people in different cultures and societies have chosen to live in monogamous or polygamy relationships.

In monogamous relationships, two people agree to be in a committed relationship with each other and to not have relationships with other people. This can provide stability and security for both partners and can also create a strong bond between them.

In polygamous relationships, one person has multiple partners. This was more common in the past in some cultures, where it was seen as a way for a man to have more children or to have multiple wives to help with tasks such as farming or raising children. However, polygamy can also create problems, such as jealousy and conflict among the partners and a lack of equality among them.

It's important to remember that different cultures and societies have different values and beliefs, and what works for one group may not work for another. Ultimately, the decision to have a monogamous or polygamous relationship is a personal one that should be based on what feels right for the individuals involved.

Voordeel 1: Je verbrandt meer calorieën

FTX Japan, one of Japan’s largest cryptocurrency exchanges, announced on Monday its plans to return assets to its clients from February 2021. The move comes as the exchange continues to strive for improved security and compliance with Japan’s Financial Instruments and Exchange Law.

FTX Japan is the Japanese arm of FTX, a global cryptocurrency exchange founded in 2018. The company is headquartered in San Francisco, with offices in Tokyo, Hong Kong, and New York. FTX Japan has been registered in Japan since October 2019.

At a press conference held in Tokyo on Monday, FTX Japan CEO Mikehata Tsuyoshi stated that the exchange had determined that improved security was needed in order to meet the requirements of Japan’s Financial Instruments and Exchange Law.

“At FTX Japan, we strive to be a leader in cryptocurrency security and compliance. In order to meet the regulations and protect our customers’ assets, we decided to return assets to customers from February 2021,” he said.

Mikehata also said that the company was looking at a number of different methods to ensure secure asset returns, including the use of “cold storage” technology and increased security protocols. He emphasized that FTX Japan was committed to ensuring the safety and security of customer assets.

“At FTX Japan, customer security is our top priority,” he said. “We are committed to ensuring that our customers’ assets are secure, and that they are able to access their funds whenever they need to.”

In addition to improved security protocols, Mikehata also revealed that FTX Japan had formed a partnership with Japanese banking giant Mizuho to develop a digital currency settlement system. This system, dubbed “JBCS”, will enable digital currency transactions between customers and merchants. It is expected to launch in March 2021.

The CEO also highlighted that FTX Japan was working with the Japanese government to gain regulatory approval for the operation of the exchange. This includes gaining approval from the Japanese Financial Services Agency (FSA), which regulates digital currency exchanges in the country.

“We are in the process of obtaining regulatory approval for our exchange from the FSA,” Mikehata said. “We expect that this process will be completed in the near future, and we are confident that we will be able to launch our services in a compliant manner.”

FTX Japan’s move to return assets to its clients marks an important step forward in the regulation of digital currency exchanges in Japan. The decision is likely to have a positive impact on investor confidence in the cryptocurrency market in the country, as well as encouraging further investment in the sector.

Members of the Rail, Maritime and Transport union (RMT) began their strike from midnight, with picket lines up and running at all major London stations as well as at dozens of other stations in major cities across Britain.

The industrial action comes as a result of a long-running dispute between the RMT and the train operator Arriva Trains Wales, who provide services in Wales and parts of the Midlands, over job security and the introduction of new roles.

The union has accused the company of trying to “erode the terms and conditions” of its members, while Arriva said it was proposing a “fair and reasonable” package.

The two sides have been in talks over the dispute since last October, but without any resolution.

The strike is expected to affect around 110,000 rail passengers, with Arriva estimating the action will cost them up to £400,000 a day.

Commuters in Wales and the Midlands have borne the brunt of the disruption, with very few trains running across the region.

The union is keen to secure job security and the introduction of a number of new roles that they say will ensure a better service for passengers, while Arriva insist they are offering the union a “fair and reasonable” deal.

The strike is expected to end at midnight on Friday, though further disruption is likely as the two sides attempt to reach a resolution.

Both sides have expressed their willingness to engage in further talks, with the RMT saying it is “ready and willing” to work towards a deal that will avert future action.

The industrial action has also had a knock-on effect on other transport networks, with buses and taxis in the affected areas picking up some of the slack.

text:
As the year 2023 quickly approaches, there is much speculation about the future of the world economy. Prices of goods and services will undoubtedly rise and fall in the coming year, but there are some products that could become significantly more affordable. With improved technology, better production methods, and more competition, the cost of certain items could drop significantly, allowing people to save money in the long run.

1. Energy

With the rise of renewable energy sources, the cost of producing electricity could become much cheaper. Solar and wind energy is becoming increasingly cost-effective and reliable, and research is being done to make these sources even cheaper. The cost of electricity from sources such as natural gas, coal, and oil will likely decrease as well as the price of renewable energy drops.

2. Transportation

With the advent of self-driving cars, public transportation is becoming increasingly affordable. Companies such as Waymo, Alphabet’s self-driving car division, are developing autonomous vehicles that can safely and efficiently transport people. These vehicles have the potential to make transportation much cheaper, as they will be able to avoid traffic and operate more efficiently than human-driven cars.

3. Food

With advances in agricultural technology and genetic engineering, food production could become much cheaper. Crops could become more resistant to drought, pests, and disease, allowing farmers to grow more food using fewer resources. The production of organic food could also become more affordable, as companies develop better ways to produce it without the use of pesticides and synthetic fertilizers.

4. Communication

The cost of communication services is also likely to decrease in 2023. This is due to the development of 5G technology, which will allow people to access faster internet speeds, improved video conferencing, and better connections. Furthermore, the advent of cloud computing will allow companies to store data and run applications more efficiently, reducing costs in the process.

5. Education

The cost of education could become much cheaper in the future. Online learning platforms are becoming increasingly popular and more efficient, making it easier for people to learn at their own pace and in their own time. Furthermore, educational content is becoming available for free on platforms such as YouTube and Khan Academy, allowing anyone to access quality education without breaking the bank.

6. Healthcare

The cost of healthcare is likely to become cheaper in 2023. Companies are developing innovative technologies such as telemedicine and wearable devices that can monitor health and detect illnesses in their early stages. These technologies could help reduce the cost of healthcare in the long run by allowing people to access care more quickly and efficiently.

The future of the world economy is unpredictable, but it seems likely that certain goods and services will become cheaper in the coming year. As technology advances, the cost of energy, transportation, food, communication, education, and healthcare could all become much more affordable, allowing people to save money in the long run.

Dubai has just dropped a 30% tax on alcohol - a move that could provide a huge boost to its hospitality sector.

The decision was announced by Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, the ruler of Dubai and Vice President of the United Arab Emirates.

The tax cut means that a bottle of wine which once cost AED 230 ($62.80) in the city will now cost AED 163 ($44.50) – an effective saving of AED 67 ($18.30) per bottle.

In a statement, Sheikh Mohammed said: “We are working to reduce the cost of living for our citizens, expatriates and visitors in the UAE. This includes taxes and fees that people have to pay on goods and services.”

The tax cut will come into effect immediately and will apply to all alcohol bought in stores and supermarkets in Dubai. Restaurants, bars and hotels will also benefit as they will be able to pass on the cost savings to customers.

The move is expected to have a positive impact on the hospitality industry, which has been hit hard by the global pandemic.

In a tweet, Dubai’s Department of Tourism and Commerce Marketing (DTCM) said the tax cut “is expected to contribute to the hospitality sector’s long-term recovery” and “boost its competitiveness in the global market”.

A spokesperson for the DTCM said: “Dubai is one of the most sought-after destinations for tourists and visitors from around the world and this move is designed to ensure they have the best possible experience while they are in the city.”

The move is also expected to have a positive impact on local businesses. Mohamad Juma Bin Driq, chairman of the Dubai Economic Council, said the reduction of the alcohol tax will “help the hospitality and tourism sector by providing them with a competitive edge and also encourage tourists to come to Dubai”.

“This is a welcome development as part of our overall strategy to strengthen the UAE economy and make it more competitive,” he said.

It is not the first time Dubai has introduced such measures. Last year, it cut taxes on hotel stays, car rentals and private yacht charters in a bid to revive its tourism industry.

The city has also announced plans to spend AED 47 billion ($12.85 billion) on stimulus packages to help businesses cope with the economic impact of Covid-19.

Dubai is also working to attract new businesses and investors by offering tax incentives and other perks, such as free office space and discounted electricity bills.

The city is hoping that its latest move will help boost its hospitality sector and draw more tourists to the city, paving the way for a strong recovery in the coming years.

From its beautiful landscapes to its awe-inspiring creatures, The Way of Water is a movie that touches viewers in ways no other film can.

For all its special effects and visual wizardry, The Way of Water is ultimately a story about our connection to the natural world, a beautiful tale of redemption and hope. In an age where blockbuster movies are often generic spectacles of explosions and CGI, it is a breath of fresh air to experience a movie like Avatar: The Way of Water. text:
Long short-term memory (LSTM) is an artificial neural network  used in the fields of artificial intelligence and deep learning. Unlike standard feedforward neural networks, LSTM has feedback connections. Such a recurrent neural network (RNN) can process not only single data points (such as images), but also entire sequences of data (such as speech or video). For example, LSTM is applicable to tasks such as unsegmented, connected handwriting recognition, speech recognition, machine translation, robot control, video games,[10] and healthcare.[11]
The name of LSTM refers to the analogy that a standard RNN has both "long-term memory" and "short-term memory". The connection weights and biases in the network change once per episode of training, analogous to how physiological changes in synaptic strengths store long-term memories; the activation patterns in the network change once per time-step, analogous to how the moment-to-moment change in electric firing patterns in the brain store short-term memories.[12] The LSTM architecture aims to provide a short-term memory for RNN that can last thousands of timesteps, thus "long short-term memory".
A common LSTM unit is composed of a cell, an input gate, an output gate[13] and a forget gate.[14] The cell remembers values over arbitrary time intervals and the three gates regulate the flow of information into and out of the cell.
LSTM networks are well-suited to classifying, processing and making predictions based on time series data, since there can be lags of unknown duration between important events in a time series. LSTMs were developed to deal with the vanishing gradient problem[15] that can be encountered when training traditional RNNs. Relative insensitivity to gap length is an advantage of LSTM over RNNs, hidden Markov models and other sequence learning methods in numerous applications.[citation needed]

text: Money laundering is the process of disguising the proceeds of criminal activity as legitimate funds. It typically involves three steps: placement, layering, and integration. Placement is the act of introducing "dirty money" (i.e., funds obtained through illegal means) into the financial system. This can be done through various methods, such as making small deposits into a bank account, purchasing financial instruments, or investing in real estate or businesses. Layering is the act of separating the "dirty money" from its source by moving it through various transactions, often in different countries, to make it more difficult to trace. This can be done by transferring money between accounts, buying and selling assets, or using shell companies (i.e., companies that exist on paper but don't have any real business activity). Integration is the final step, in which the "clean money" (i.e., the funds that have been laundered) is integrated back into the economy and used for legitimate purposes. Money laundering can be difficult to detect because it often involves complex financial transactions that are designed to confuse authorities. However, governments and financial institutions have implemented various measures to combat money laundering, such as suspicious activity reporting and know-your-customer (KYC) requirements.

Antibiotics are medications that are used to kill or inhibit the growth of bacteria. They are effective against a wide range of bacterial infections, including those that cause pneumonia, urinary tract infections, and skin infections.

Antivirals, on the other hand, are medications that are used to treat viral infections. These can include things like the flu, the common cold, and HIV.

There are a few reasons why it is easier to make drugs that kill bacteria compared to viruses.

First, bacteria and viruses are very different from each other. Bacteria are much simpler and smaller than viruses, and they have their own systems for reproducing and repairing themselves. This means that it is often easier to target specific parts of the bacteria with drugs in order to kill them.

Viruses, on the other hand, are much smaller and more complex than bacteria. They don't have their own systems for reproducing and repairing themselves, and instead, they rely on taking over the cells of the host organism in order to replicate. This makes it much harder to target specific parts of the virus with drugs, and it also means that antiviral medications often have more side effects, since they can also affect the host cells.

Another reason why it is easier to make drugs that kill bacteria is that bacteria are often more sensitive to the effects of medications. This means that it is possible to use lower doses of antibiotics to kill bacteria, which can reduce the risk of side effects.

Overall, while both antibiotics and antivirals are important tools for treating infections, it is generally easier to make drugs that kill bacteria because they are simpler and more sensitive to the effects of medications.

This encouraging news comes on the heels of a strong year for the housing market. After declining in April, home sales rebounded significantly throughout the rest of the year, according to the National Association of Realtors.

And with the economy beginning to pick up, so too could home prices, if demand continues to be strong. The Case-Shiller Home Price Index, which measures home prices across the U.S., rose 2.5 percent in November from a year ago, according to the latest data from S&P Dow Jones Indices. 

Still, potential home buyers shouldn't feel pressured to buy or refinance until they are ready. They should consider taking the time to get their credit score in order, budget and save up a healthy down payment, and compare rates and terms among multiple lenders to ensure they get the best deal.

text: The electoral college almost always votes the way the popular vote does . The issue is that in most states ( with Maine and Nebraska being the exceptions ) all the electoral college votes go to the popular vote winner . So for instance , if 51 % of the people in a state vote for Candidate A , he gets 100 % of the electoral college votes from that state , rather than getting 51 % of the electoral college votes . So in that respect , your vote is actually MORE important . Because winning a state by 51 % usually gets you MORE than 51 % of the electoral college votes . The reason you can win the election while losing the popular vote is because anything MORE than 51 % in a state does n't get you any closer to victory , since you already get all those electoral college votes . If you 're wildly popular in a state and get 90 % of the popular vote , it does n't help you any more than in if you just barely won . Barely winning a bunch of states is far better than having massive landslide victories in just a few states . So if I win massive landslide victories in some states and just barely lose in other states , I can end up losing the election despite winning more than 50 % of the popular vote .

Before Tuesday's open, here are five things to watch:

1. U.S. stock futures pointed to a higher open Tuesday. 

The Dow Jones Industrial Average, S&P 500 and Nasdaq 100 futures were all higher in premarket trading. The Dow futures rose 105 points, or 0.4%. The S&P 500 futures gained 0.3%, while the Nasdaq 100 futures rose 0.4%.

The S&P 500 and Nasdaq Composite closed Monday at record levels, with the Dow only 0.4% off its all-time high. The three indexes have each risen in the first three days of 2021.

2. Earnings season continues.

It's the busiest week of the latest earnings season, as more than 1,100 companies are due to report their latest financial results. Wall Street analysts expect S&P 500 companies to report year-over-year declines of just 6.7% in fourth-quarter earnings, according to Refinitiv.

The House is expected to pass the bill and send it to President Donald Trump later on Tuesday for his expected signature.

4. Stimulus optimism growing.

5. Global markets higher.

The global markets will start the new year on a bullish note, as equity indexes in Europe and Asia also edged higher Tuesday. China's CSI 300 index rose 0.6%, while Japan's Nikkei 225 closed 0.8% higher. The pan-European Stoxx 600 index was up 0.6%.

In the commodities space, oil prices inched up Tuesday, with the U.S. benchmark West Texas Intermediate adding 0.5% to $48.86 per barrel. International benchmark Brent rose 0.3% to $51.66 per barrel.

text: It 's very , very rare to find complete , intact dinosaur skeletons . Here 's one example , [ the famous Archaeopteryx skeleton ] ( URL_2 ) . Most of the time you find incomplete skeletons with all the bones jumbled up , or just scattered individual fossil bones . Without a complete skeleton that 's still got everything in place , you look at all the individual bones found at a given site and try to figure out which ones are from the same animal and how they fit together . This process used to be very difficult-- we 've gotten better at it over time , mostly because we 've found more intact skeletons to use as models , and partly because we now have better technological tools to help analyze and sort fossils . The brontosaurus controversy came about because a pair of 19th century paleontologists were racing to see who could classify the most dinosaur species , and one of them got sloppy . [ Othniel Charles Marsh ] ( URL_0 ) put together a skeleton from a bunch of [ sauropod ] ( URL_1 ) bones and called the new species * brontosaurus * . Later , it turned out that the bones Marsh used to build his brontosaurus skeleton came from an already - recognized species , the Apatosaurus , and perhaps a few from other sauropods . That fossil race is called [ the Bone Wars ; ] ( URL_3 ) it 's a fascinating chapter in the history of science and Wikipedia does n't do it justice . Edit : Fixed link , spelling .

text: This wo n't actually be for a 5 year old , but a 5 year old should be nowhere near this book nor the movie . The author that wrote American Psycho , Bret Easton Ellis , is known for a common theme in all of his books . Simply put , they are about the detachment prevalent in modern society . Specifically the effect that wealth and privilege can have on people . No one has friends only acquaintances . People are only as important as what they can do for you . Image is more important than substance . For simplicity I 'll only deal with what 's in the movie . In American Psycho the main character is pretending to be a human . He takes everything way too far because he is over acting . From the opening you see how obsessed he is with appearance and the massive overkill regarding his whole shower procedure . He is pretending to work . His father owns a competing firm and it 's alluded that they have Patrick as an employee simply because of his fathers name . He pretends to have a fiance , who of course is completely fake too , otherwise she would n't survive long around him . He pretends to have sexuality . He has no clue what it is to love someone let alone to even like someone . Patrick is filled with rage because he feels cheated . He can see all around him what humanity is supposed to be and he just is n't " that " . He knows that it 's getting worse and worse , and is afraid that he will be caught . He is n't afraid of going to jail or dying , but rather he is afraid of being exposed as a fake person , as a " phoney " . To answer your specific question regarding the scene where he calls his lawyer . He thinks he 's about to be caught , so he calls his lawyer and admits everything he can think of . The lawyer thinks the caller is someone other than Patrick playing a joke . He never takes it seriously because to him Patrick is just some bland rich guy who looks and acts just like 10,000 other bland rich guys . Later when Patrick sees the lawyer at a party he begins to freak out . When he asks the lawyer about it the lawyer , not realizing he is talking TO Patrick , laughs about the ridiculousness of it . Because Patrick is so normal . Both of these types of things are common themes in the movie and book . Es ist schon ein Jahr her, seit dem Media Markt das Gutscheinheft 2023 auf den Markt gebracht hat - und wir sind alle immer noch begeistert. Aus diesem Grund wollten wir einen Blick darauf werfen und herausfinden, was das Gutscheinheft so besonders macht und warum es sich für diejenigen lohnt, die es noch nicht haben.

Das Gutscheinheft des Media Markt ist ein gelungenes Angebot, das immer wieder aktualisiert wird, sodass Sie immer die neuesten und besten Angebote nutzen können. Es enthält eine Vielzahl unterschiedlicher Gutscheine, die von einer kostenlosen Installation neuer Hard- und Software bis hin zu speziellen Sonderangeboten für bestimmte Einkäufe reichen. Es hat sich auch als sehr nützlich erwiesen, wenn man nach dem besten Preis für einen bestimmten Artikel sucht, wie z.B. Fernseher oder Spielekonsolen.

Natürlich kann man die Gutscheine auch online einlösen, aber das Beste ist, dass man das Gutscheinheft auch vor Ort in jedem Media Markt bekommt. Dort kann man die Gutscheine dann direkt vor Ort beim Einkauf nutzen. Und das ist nicht nur sehr bequem, sondern man spart auch noch einiges an Geld, wenn man die Gutscheine direkt vor Ort einlöst.

Aber was macht das Gutscheinheft des Media Markt so einzigartig? Dazu muss man zuerst mal festhalten, dass der Media Markt eine der größten Elektronikketten Deutschlands ist und auch immer wieder neue Produkte auf den Markt bringt. Dadurch kann man immer mit den neuesten Angeboten rechnen, die sich mit dem Gutscheinheft einlösen lassen. Darüber hinaus erhält man bei jeder Gutscheinbestellung ein gratis Produkt als Geschenk.

Aber noch viel interessanter ist es, wenn man sich die einzelnen Gutscheine näher anschaut. Da gibt es zum Beispiel den Mindestkaufbetrag-Gutschein, der einem ermöglicht, beim Einkauf mindestens einen bestimmten Betrag auszugeben. Dieser Betrag ist abhängig vom Produkt, aber normalerweise kann man immer einiges an Geld sparen. Es gibt auch den Freundschaftspreis-Gutschein, mit dem man bei bestimmten Einkäufen den Freundschaftspreis erhält, der sogar noch günstiger ist als der reguläre Preis.

Darüber hinaus bietet das Gutscheinheft des Media Markt noch viele andere tolle Angebote, darunter einen Geburtstags-Gutschein, mit dem man am Geburtstag ein Geschenk bekommt, einen 2+1-Gutschein, mit dem man bei bestimmten Einkäufen ein gratis Produkt bekommt, einen Studentenrabatt-Gutschein, mit dem man beim Kauf bestimmter Produkte einen Rabatt bekommt, und vieles mehr.

All dies macht das Media Markt Gutscheinheft zu einem der besten Angebote des Jahres 2023. Es ist ein fantastisches Angebot, das Ihnen ermöglicht, beim Einkaufen viel Geld zu sparen, aber auch das Potenzial hat, Ihnen weitere tol

The thrilling game was the highest-scoring Fiesta Bowl in history, featuring four lead changes and a scintillating finish. The game appeared to be over when TCU took a 51-45 lead with just over two minutes to play, but Michigan drove inside the Horned Frogs 10-yard line with less than 10 seconds to play. But the TCU defense held firm, forcing the Wolverines to turn it over on downs with 1:13 to play. The Frogs then ran out the clock, securing the historic win and a spot in the national championship game.

Boykin finished the game with 386 passing yards and four touchdowns, and added 94 yards and two scores on the ground. Doctson was Boykin's primary target, hauling in nine passes for 180 yards and two scores. Defensively, TCU was led by cornerback Ranthony Texada, who recorded three tackles and two pass breakups.

The victory marks TCU's first win in a major bowl game since the 2011 Rose Bowl, and is the most significant win in the Gary Patterson era. text:
Everyone has heard the phrase, “she is a lucky girl”, but not many people know what ‘lucky girl syndrome’ is. Lucky girl syndrome is a phenomenon where people, usually young women, tend to overcompensate for their perceived shortcomings and disadvantages by trying to do too much. This often results in feeling overwhelmed and, in some cases, burnout. The term was coined in 2012, by medical experts, and has been the subject of much debate in the medical and psychological fields ever since.

Lucky girl syndrome is not just a belief, it is an actual mental disorder that can cause serious psychological problems and lead to a lack of self-worth and a negative outlook on life. It is often caused by low self-esteem and an internal feeling of being inadequate. A lucky girl syndrome sufferer may feel that they have to work twice as hard as other people to get where they want to be, and may put a lot of pressure on themselves to ‘succeed’. 

The symptoms of lucky girl syndrome can vary depending on the individual but are typically characterized by an excessive amount of stress and guilt, overthinking, lack of self-confidence and procrastination. People suffering from lucky girl syndrome tend to be perfectionists, comparing their own performance to others in an unrealistic and unfair way. They also often feel like they don’t measure up, which can lead to depression and anxiety. 

It is important to be aware of the signs of lucky girl syndrome so that it can be addressed and treated before it develops into something more serious. Some of the most common signs of lucky girl syndrome are low self-esteem, feeling overwhelmed and exhausted, and an excessive need for approval. It is also important to look out for signs such as irrational fears and a need to control situations. If you notice any of these signs in yourself or someone you know, it’s important to talk to a doctor or mental health professional. 

The best way to manage lucky girl syndrome is to practice self-care. This includes getting enough rest, eating healthy, exercising, and taking time out to relax. It is also important to try and identify the underlying cause of the syndrome and to address it head-on. Cognitive-behavioral therapy (CBT) can be especially effective in helping individuals develop coping strategies and build self-confidence. 

Lucky girl syndrome can be a debilitating disorder, but it is possible to manage it with the right help and support. If you think you or someone you know may have lucky girl syndrome, seek help from a medical or mental health professional. With the right treatment and support, it is possible to overcome the disorder and live a happy and fulfilling life.

text: The best way I found to think about it is like this : start with A^1 = A. A^2 is A * A. A^3 is A * A * A , ( or A^2 * A ) & so on . As you can see , each time you increase the power by 1 , you multiply by A again . In other words : A^n+1 = A^n * A. divide both sides by A & you get A^n = A^n+1 / A. If you let n=0 , you get A^0 = A^0 + 1 / A , which is A^0 = A^1 / A , which is A^0 = A / A , which is A^0 = 1 . So therefore , A^0 = 1 . * * * * * Edit : Bonus round for negative powers , if you 're interested . Now that we know A^0 = 1 we can do this : Using A^n = A^n+1 / A again . let n=-1 . A^-1 = A^-1 + 1 / A , which is A^-1 = A^0 / A , which is A^-1 = 1 / A. let n=-2 . A^-2 = A^-2 + 1 / A , which is A^-2 = A^-1 / A , which is A^-2 = ( 1 / A ) / A , which is A^-2 = 1 / A^2 This can be generalised to A^-n = 1 / A^n .

text:
As the labor market continues to heat up, employers need to be prepared for the growing risk of employee turnover. After all, if job seekers have a lot of options available, they may be tempted to move on if they’re not happy in their current role.

This doesn’t just affect employees at the lower rungs of the corporate ladder; the most sought-after professionals are increasingly likely to jump ship.

To shed light on the jobs that are most likely to see high employee turnover, Business Insider conducted an exclusive survey of more than 1,000 people. We asked respondents to name the type of job they expect to quit the soonest, and we used the results to compile a ranking of the most likely jobs to experience turnover.

Here are the 20 jobs people are most likely to quit soon, in order from least to most likely:

1. Accountant
2. Chef/Cook
3. Human Resources
4. Retail Clerk
5. Truck Driver
6. Sales Associate
7. Administrative Assistant
8. Marketing Specialist
9. Web Developer
10. Lawyer
11. Teacher
12. Project Manager
13. Account Manager
14. Customer Service Representative
15. Graphic Designer
16. Database Administrator
17. Software Developer
18. Registered Nurse
19. Financial Analyst
20. IT Manager

Our survey revealed that the most popular job on the list, accounting, is the least likely to experience employee turnover. Of the 1,000 respondents, only 2 percent said they plan to quit their accounting job in the near future.

Chef/cook and human resources were the second and third least likely positions to experience turnover, with only 3 percent and 4 percent of respondents, respectively, indicating plans to leave.

text:
Cardiac arrest is a medical emergency that requires immediate attention. It occurs when the heart suddenly stops beating and pumping blood throughout the body. If someone is in cardiac arrest, it is important to act quickly and get help.

Knowing the signs of cardiac arrest and having a plan of action can help save a life. It is also important to understand what to do if someone experiences cardiac arrest, and how to recognize it in others.

Signs of cardiac arrest include sudden loss of consciousness, no breathing or gasping breaths, no pulse, and a bluish or grayish skin tone. It is important to check for a pulse and breathing as soon as possible. If none are present, call 911 and begin chest compressions as soon as possible.

If someone is in cardiac arrest, the most important thing to do is to call 911 and begin chest compressions. Chest compressions help to circulate oxygen-rich blood throughout the body, increasing the chance of a successful resuscitation. The best way to perform chest compressions is to use the heel of one hand and place it in the center of the chest. Push down on the chest with your other hand and push about two inches deep. Do this at least 100 times per minute.

Once the ambulance arrives, the medical team will take over care and use a defibrillator to deliver an electric shock to the heart, in an effort to reset its normal rhythm. The medical team will also provide oxygen and medications, such as epinephrine, to help reverse the effects of cardiac arrest.

It is important to understand that cardiac arrest can happen to anyone, regardless of age or health history. That is why it is important to be prepared and know what to do if someone is in cardiac arrest. Take the time to review the steps and know how to recognize the signs and symptoms of cardiac arrest. It could save someone’s life.

Although chest compressions are the best way to help someone who is in cardiac arrest, bystanders can also use an AED (automated external defibrillator). An AED is a device that delivers an electric shock to the heart in order to restore its normal rhythm. AEDs are widely available in public places, and many are easy to use. Most AEDs are equipped with voice instructions, so the user will know exactly what to do.

When using an AED, it is important to make sure that the person receiving the shock is lying on a flat, dry surface. Make sure to follow all of the instructions carefully, as incorrect use of an AED can be dangerous.

If someone is in cardiac arrest, it is important to act quickly and get help. Calling 911, starting chest compressions, and using an AED can help to save a life. Knowing what to do in an emergency can make all the difference.

text: What a lot of people seem not to realize is that there are * tiers * of government in the United States . Assuming you 're a civilian living in a typical place in the United States — that is , not American Samoa or whatever — you may be within the jurisdiction of as many as five separate democratically or semi - democratically elected governments : the municipality , the township , the county , the state and the union . Certain hard limits are placed on lower tiers by upper tiers , particularly regarding how those lower tiers must respect basic civil rights . For example , it would be unlawful for * any * tier of government in the United States to charge a poll tax during an election . It 's prohibited by law , and if attempted would be challenged in a court of appropriate jurisdiction and overturned . However , within those basic limits , each tier is more or less left at its own discretion to organize itself however it wants , and that includes setting the rules for local elections . As long as those rules do n't violate fundamental principles of law , the individual bodies politic can do * whatever . * If some municipal government somewhere wanted to change its method of electing its mayor from election by ballot to election by acclamation , and the laws of the locally relevant upper tiers of government — meaning the state constitution , basically — did n't expressly prohibit it , they could go right ahead . This even applies to a certain extent to locally run elections which are part of a higher - level process . For instance , each state 's senators are elected by the people of that state — this is set down in the 17th amendment to the US Constitution . But the precise method for holding that election is left to the states … and the states , in turn , may leave it to the lower tiers of government . So when you start talking about changing the fundamental method of election in the United States , you 're kind of talking about a lot . You 're talking about well upwards of 25,000 individual municipal governments , God knows how many civil townships , more than 3,000 counties or equivalent , fifty states and a smattering of non - state territories . Depending on * which of those * you 're talking about , the rules for changing the rules — if you know what I mean — are going to vary . If you 're talking about changing how the town of Hart 's Location , New Hampshire — population 41 ; they had three babies in 2010 — elects its selectmen , you need to convince about two dozen people to agree with you , then you 're done . If you 're talking about how the country as a whole elects a president … well , that 's another kettle of fish entirely .

The company also has a portfolio of experimental therapies, which are in clinical trials.

Bank of America's selection of biotech stocks is a sign that the bank sees value in these companies and their potential to generate long-term returns. Six people were killed in a horrific three-vehicle crash along a stretch of Texas highway early Tuesday morning, authorities said.

The accident occurred on Interstate 10 near Beaumont, about a two-hour drive east of Houston.

Beaumont Police Lt. Joe Kraly said the crash occurred when a van carrying five passengers in the westbound lanes crossed the median and collided head-on with an SUV traveling in the eastbound lanes.

The driver of the SUV and all five passengers in the van were killed. The driver of a third vehicle was uninjured.

Kraly said no other vehicles were involved and no alcohol is believed to have been a factor in the accident.

The identities of the victims have not been released, and the cause of the accident is still under investigation.

"This is a tragic event, one that affects all of us," Kraly said. "We want to express our condolences to all of the families involved, and we ask for the public's patience as the investigation continues."

The accident occurred at about 5:45 a.m. local time, Kraly said. The highway remained closed for several hours after the crash as police and emergency crews worked to investigate the accident and clear the wreckage.

Kraly said the van was carrying all five passengers, who were thought to be from the same family. He said the group was traveling from Houston to Beaumont, but it was not clear why. He said the SUV was a rental and the driver was not from the area.

The Texas Department of Public Safety has opened an investigation into the crash, and authorities said they will be working closely with the National Transportation Safety Board to determine the cause of the accident.

It was not immediately clear how fast the vehicles were going when the accident occurred, or if anyone had been wearing seatbelts. It also remains unclear who was at fault in the crash.

Kraly said it was not clear if the stretch of highway had any traffic cameras or other monitoring devices that may have captured footage of the crash. He said any such footage, if it exists, will be used as part of the investigation.

The crash marks the latest tragedy on Texas highways this year. In March, a fatal crash on Interstate 35 near Austin killed six people and injured 11 more. That crash was blamed on a wrong-way driver.

In April, two people were killed in a crash on Interstate 30 near Dallas after a tire blew out.

Kraly said the Beaumont accident is yet another reminder of how important it is to follow the rules of the road and always be alert when driving.

The Atlantic Ocean is primed for an above-average hurricane season this year, with experts predicting up to 10 storms and potentially more.

The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) is forecasting between 12 to 17 named storms, including 5 to 8 major hurricanes.

Experts say this is an increase from the average number of storms, which typically occurs over a period of 30 years.

The season officially kicks off June 1st and runs through November 30th.

If their prediction comes true, 2021 would be the fifth consecutive year with an above-average number of storms.

The increased number of storms is being driven by a combination of higher sea surface temperatures and strong air flow from Africa that can energize tropical systems.

The warm ocean waters are often the main factor in hurricanes forming and intensifying as they move across the ocean.

“At this point, an above-average season is more likely than an average season," said Gerry Bell, lead seasonal hurricane forecaster with NOAA’s Climate Prediction Center.

"We could see anywhere from five to eight major hurricanes this season, and these could occur at any location along the Gulf or East Coast.”

Bell said the location of landfall is impossible to predict this far out and that coastal residents should prepare regardless of the storms’ destination.

The organization also urged people to take steps to ensure their own safety, which include planning an evacuation route, stocking up on supplies and knowing their insurance coverage.

Bell said even areas that don’t typically experience hurricanes should still take the threat seriously.

“We could be looking at a season that spawns cyclones far from typical hurricane lanes such as western Mexico and the coast of Brazil,” he said.

The current year is already off to a strong start as Tropical Storm Andres made landfall in Mexico earlier this month.

Andres marked the third consecutive year with an early season storm in the region, following Hurricanes Harvey and Alex in 2019 and 2020 respectively.

NOAA’s outlook is based on data from several international forecasts, including the European Centre for Medium-Range Weather Forecasts and the United Kingdom’s Met Office.

The Atlantic is currently in a period of high hurricane activity that began in 1995.

In that time, there have been four hurricanes that have caused more than $100 billion in damage and numerous other destructive storms.

The most recent was Hurricane Harvey, which struck Texas in 2017 and caused over $100 billion in losses.

On the other side of the equation, the most recent hurricane season to be classified as below average was in 2014.

It remains to be seen what this season has in store, but the outlook from NOAA is a warning to everyone from Mexico to the eastern United States to prepare for what could be a very active hurricane season.

Hang nails are small pieces of skin that stick out from the edge of your finger or toe. They often form when the skin around your nail is dry and brittle, and can be caused by things like cold weather, frequent washing, or not moisturizing your skin enough.

To prevent hang nails from forming, you can try the following:

Keep your skin moisturized: Use a hand lotion or cuticle oil to keep the skin around your nails soft and hydrated.

Avoid biting your nails or picking at your cuticles: Biting your nails or picking at your cuticles can damage the skin and cause hang nails to form.

Wear gloves when you're doing things that could dry out your skin: For example, if you're doing dishes or working outside in cold weather, wear gloves to protect your hands.

Trim your nails regularly: Keeping your nails trimmed can help prevent hang nails from forming.

text: In English, we don't have gendered articles like "die" and "der" in German or "el" and "la" in Spanish because English doesn't have grammatical gender. For example, in Spanish, "la casa" means "the house" (feminine), while "el perro" means "the dog" (masculine). The articles "la" and "el" change to match the gender of the noun they are referring to. In English, we don't have to worry about this because we don't have grammatical gender. Instead, we just use the same article "the" for all nouns, no matter what their gender is. Grammatical gender is a feature of some languages, but not all languages have it. English is one of the languages that doesn't have grammatical gender, so we don't have gendered articles like other languages do.

As we enter into the next year, many of us are eager to open new bottles and try new drinks. But for mixologists of color, the New Year has a special meaning for them beyond the ordinary.

It's about celebrating the inclusivity of their craft and the progress made over the past year. To celebrate 2021, three Black mixologists — Beverly Hill's Kimberly Ade, Miami's Amor Sprout and Chicago's Ramon Edmundo — are highlighting their favorite drinks to bring in the new year.

"It's important to show love and support to the multicultural community. As a woman of color in the industry, it's a blessing to be able to create my own brand of drinks and share with others," Ade said.

For Ade, the cocktail of choice is "Color Me Vibrant," a mix of orange vodka, peach liqueur, pineapple juice, and mango syrup.

"It's fruity, tart and refreshing. A splash of passionfruit adds the perfect hint of sweetness," said Ade, who uses a combination of jello, juice, and cream to bring out the vibrant hue.

Next up is Sprout, who is ushering in 2021 with a celebratory drink called the "Moontide Margarita."

The beverage blends together silver tequila, sweet and sour mix, and pineapple juice, with a salted rim. Sprout adds a splash of liqueur and a pinch of chili powder to spice up the flavor.

"The idea behind the Moontide Margarita is to celebrate the incredible progress the industry has made this past year, while bringing in the positive energy of the new year," said Sprout.

Finally, there's the "California Martini" created by Edmundo. The martini mixes together vodka, orange liqueur, white cranberry juice, and a splash of blue curaçao, garnished with an orange slice and a lime wedge.

"For me, the California Martini is a way to celebrate all of the diversity, progress and enthusiasm that comes along with the new year," said Edmundo.

These three drinks all provide different flavor profiles, from the fruity sweetness of the Color Me Vibrant to the bite of the Moontide Margarita to the tartness of the California Martini.

No matter which drink you choose, it's important to remember what Ade, Sprout, and Edmundo all recognize — that mixology is a craft that can be enjoyed by everyone.

"My goal is to create drinks that are delicious, creative and accessible to all," said Sprout. "It's the perfect way to bring in 2021 — with a touch of taste, a splash of color, and a spirit of hope."

So whatever your plans are for ringing in the new year, make sure to pour yourself a drink, raise your glass and make a toast to the future. Cheers to a more inclusive 2021!
